column7: Victorian house, room with double bed and en suite
column8: My house is in a quiet residential road in Redland with good transport links,  into the city and beyond. It is well located and is 5 minutes walk from Whiteladies Road with  easy access to a wide range of shops , restaurants, bars, cafes and pubs. It is perfectly located for walking to The Downs, Clifton Village and the city centre. The BBC and Bristol University are within an easy 20 min walk. It is also very convenient for Clifton College, the Spire Hospital and the Old Vic Theatre School.
column9: Redland is an attractive residential suburb to the north of the city centre near the Downs. The architecture of the area is predominantly Victorian and it benefits from a wide range of local amenities. The house is situated 5 minutes from Whiteladies Road, with access to a wide variety of shops, supermarkets, restaurants, cafes and pubs. It is perfectly located for walking to Bristol University, BBC, BRI, The Spire Hospital, Bristol Zoo Gardens, The Downs, Clifton Village and the City Centre.
column16: My husband Dermot and I love cycling,we are both regular cyclists here in Bristol and have had cycling holidays abroad. We love to travel and this year visited  some of the national parks of North America. We love  trying different cuisines. I love reading and I am in a local book club. We have met lots of wonderful people through hosting and also  enjoyed being Airbnb guests. It's a great way of getting to know local areas etc. I speak some French. We love our home and living in Bristol and we hope you enjoy it too.

column7: Tranquil studio flat, easy access central Bristol
column8: Avonview Studio (www bristolpad co uk/avonview-studio html) offers  business-class comfort and fine views in the tranquility of the Avon Valley. Walking distance from central rail station and easy reach to central Bristol. Patio garden.Street parking. [Longer stay (at least 14 days) Guests are welcome to contact us more than three months in advance to request a booking]
column9:
The Studio offers ready access both to central Bristol, to Bath by car or train, and to the River Avon Valley and local parks and nature reserve (two minutes down to the river walks).
For central Bristol, 36 bus stop within 2 minutes walk, bus half hourly (hourly during daytime on Sundays); or 25 minutes walk to Temple Meads which is a transport hub for buses all over Bristol as well as local and national trains; or drive to centre 10-20 minutes depending on traffic, then use pay park or some free places in evenings; or taxi (£8?). Bus timetables online or use Bristol Bus timetable live app. Hard copy of 36 timetable at studio, along with taxi cards and some rail timetables.
It is two minutes walk to the local Village Centre which has a fair sized Co-Op (with Amazon locker and cashpoint), local Indian, Chinese, Pizza and café outlets, GP surgery and Lloyds chemists shop.
Avonmeads Retail Park within 4 minutes drive or 25 minutes on foot has numerous outlets, some 24/7,
column16:
My wife and I have busy professional jobs which have given us a great deal of experience over the years with many types of people, different cultural settings and nationalities. We also own property which we let to young professionals and have had extensive experience both with lodgers and tenants (over 150 contracts); and with property development and maintenance. An overview, including testimonials, can be viewed at www bristolpad co uk. We are recognized for being efficient and pro-active in ensuring that the accommodation we provide is of high standard and well maintained. We are NLA and ICO registered. 
The Avonview Studio flat described here represents an annex development which we feel will be attractive both for business and holiday travellers to the Bristol area. It is our first experience of short term letting / managed apartments and we are committed to ensuring that we provide a high standard of service. We also have excellent local contacts and contractors to support our services.

column7: Private cosy flat, free road parking and garden
column8: Come and stay in our cosy private annexe in the lovely Windmill Hill area. It is 20 minutes walk to the docks and centre,  3 minutes from food shops. Cosy up by the wood-burning stove or sit out in a private garden.
column9: Windmill hill is a very community spirited friendly neighbourhood.  There are lots of community events, eg music in the park, arts trail, street parties, bonfire night, concerts in the church, fun day in park. It is right beside one of the nicest parks in Bristol, and conveniently located near the centre, but without seeming too busy.

Private space consists of the bedroom, lounge and bathroom. The only shared space is the kitchen, entrance and garden.

Part of a Victorian era town house, minutes walk from the vibrant and lively Stoke Croft. Close to Cabot Circus shopping center.
column9: St. Pauls is a vibrant area of Bristol close to the city center. Stokes Croft is minutes away and has been rejuvenated in recent years with independent coffee shops, bars and restaurants.

column8: Welcome to our 1930's mid terrace home in the quiet friendly suburb of Horfield, where you will find a relaxing heart warming atmosphere.  The inside decor is contemporary with original features. You will have a light stylish double room to stay in.
column9:
There are many reasons why you should choose us as a host: whether you are here as a tourist, family or on business, or even check out what Bristol has to offer as a place you might want to choose to in live in the future........

Our street and surrounding area is very friendly and secure. There is a pub very close to where we live called 'The Inn on the Green' which is an excellent pub, which serves a selection of local ales, great food and great staff. They open most of the day and is a great place to meet friends and family. If you fancy something different, try the Raj Pavilions which has great customer service and amazing curry dishes. There is also convenience store and launderette a couple of streets away.

column7: Cosy apartment close to city centre
column8: The well furnished apartment adjoins the owner's family home and is very quiet and secure.  The train station is 10 mins away by bus and the town centre 15 min.  The airport is 20 mins away by taxi (around £20). There is plenty of street parking available.
column9: Very quiet residential road lined with trees.  Most properties are large detached town houses.  Easy access to the city centre which is 2.5 miles away. There is free parking on the road.

column8:
Quiet house in cul-de-sac, on street parking and a spacious but cosy bedroom. Low ceiling, max height 6' 2". Unusually for an inner city location, there is as yet no parking restrictions. We are idyllically located on top of Windmill Hill overlooking Victoria Park with easy access to the city centre. Guests have a private bathroom on the ground floor and an attractive garden to sit in when the weather permits. We also offer a wi-fi connection.

We can accommodate either one or two guests.
column9: Windmill Hill is an area known for its high concentration of artists and community spirit. Your host is a professional writer and entertainer. There are many things happening locally. Guests have commended the food at the local pub, The Windmill. There is also a very good Indian restaurant five minutes away, Ganesha.
column16: I am a self employed writer and entertainer. My partner Sally Britton is a company director. We both read a lot and enjoy live entertainments such as theatre and music events. Sally is vegetarian. We eat a mainly whole food diet. Favourite holiday destinations: Turkey, Morocco and the Lake District. We have both travelled extensively. We offer a quiet comfortable house for interesting thoughtful people.

column8:
Self-catering studio in the heart of the City District of Bristol, UK.
Bang in the centre of town, this unique designer studio apartment is on the quiet side of the building overlooking St Nick's Market 45 seconds above the city swirl !

column7: Comfortable and Clean Flat - Great Location
column8: A stylish and comfortable one bed flat just off the bustling Gloucester Rd with its great range of independent shops, bars and restaurants. We’re around 20 mins walk into town and close to great local, national and international transport links. This is a vibrant central area but a fairly quiet road. Parking can be difficult during the day but usually OK in the evening and at weekends. There is a lovely park just around the corner and a thriving independent high street.
column9:
The Gloucester Rd is a few steps away and we are lucky enough to have some of the best restaurants and gastro pubs nearby. It is the longest road of independent shops in Europe and has a really good selection including a couple of good supermarkets within 5 mins walk, as well as bakers, butchers, fishmongers, greengrocers, gift shops, clothes shops, health food, delis etc. There are also some great retro, vintage and charity shops.

There is a Congestion Zone charge for some cars in the centre. We are not in that zone but do be aware if you are driving here with a non compliant car.

The flat is a short walk away from Gloucester Cricket Club which hosts local, national and international matches. There is a great blog about all the lovely places to eat locally in the flat too. We can send the link if you'd like to plan!
column16: I sell mid century furniture and homeware and I love living in Bristol.  I enjoy all the theatre, art and culture that the city has to offer.  I love the food scene in Bristol so have plenty of local information regarding markets and restaurants.  I also enjoy the fact that we have some of the best arts centres in the country and a fabulous local independent neighbourhood.

column9: Like most of Bristol St Judes is a very multicultural neighborhood, with many shops stocking a wide range of international foods. There are also traditional English pubs in close proximity, and is very close to the gay district of Old MArket

column7: 20 mins to Stokes Croft & city centre, quiet oasis
column8:
20-minute walk to Cabot Circus Shopping Mall & Gloucester Rd ( jam-packed with local, independent shops & cafes) & Stokes Croft, famed for its counter culture, street art and Banksy work.

The house backs onto green spaces & walks to a city farm, has solar panels & I use eco products. Resident cat.

I've always worked in community arts (used to run a circus school) with a wide range of people. I'm used to & enjoy sharing the house & work for a small arts charity.
column9:
We're part of an inner city village of three roads connected by back lanes and
a very strong community. My road is a 1930's Cul de sac there's a mixture of people who have lived on the road, some for many years, and young families who have recently moved in.

The house backs onto green spaces and walks, is 10 minutes from an inner city farm and 20 inner city organic small holding.

There are local shops, including a mini organic supermarket.
column16:
Born in Swansea, South Wales, I moved to London to train as a dancer many years ago, since then I've worked in the arts  and community sectors  all my life.

 I moved to Bristol 30 years ago and love it more each year!

Currently I work for a small Arts on Prescription organisation based in Gloucester.

I enjoy travel (self catering style), meeting folk, camping, cold water swimming, walking, gardening and a laugh. I'm a pescatarian.

The house has solar panels & I use eco products as much as I can.  I have a cat, Chomsky.

I've always worked with a wide range of people, I'm used to and enjoy living in shared housing  & have done  for most of my adult life.  I  currently have a full time lodger as well.

I'd say I'm warm, friendly, respectful and informal.

I'd like you to enjoy your time in Bristol.

column7: Calm, spacious ensuite near Southmead Hosp. 1 or 2
column8:
My home is in a quiet residential street close to; Southmead Hospital, Green space, Public sports centre with pool, local pubs, UWE, Airbus, MOD, Rolls Royce. A bus ride to City Centre and transport links including airport bus. Welcome to couples, singles, business travellers, and families (with kids). Plenty of local eating options or cook your own.
Bathroom private as ensuite if no -one in my other air bnb room (a single with a space for put up bed so families welcome).Ideal for the hospital
column9:
A nice area to live - a quiet street in a vibrant interesting historic city.
Bristol has lots to offer - loads of lovely restaurants, Bristol university and University of the West of England (UWE), cycle routes, green space, a harbour. Its easy to travel to Bristol - M4 , M5 , 1.5 hrs by rail from London, an airport, plenty of buses. My home is close to Bristol Rovers Football Ground and Gloucestershire County Cricket ground - both walking distance. We also have Bristol Rugby and Bristol City football in the city.
column16:
I'm self employed and working from home so I'm around quite a bit and happy to assist my guests. I love to cook and have a new kitchen - very exciting!
Am a cyclist and enjoy DIY and patchwork and watching rugby. I have a large garden so I must surely enjoy gardening!! I have 2 grown up children so I'm used to children of all ages and I've been involved in Girlguiding most of my life.

column9: For eating out in the area we have local pubs, takeaways, and restaurants. Southmead Hospital is a short walk away if you need to visit someone or have an appointment or are working there. Other large employers  - Airbus, MOD, Rolls Royce are close by bus and also UWE and Bristol University. Our historic city is a great place to explore with lots going on. We have green space nearby and also a public gym /swimming pool. Cycling popular in the city - bring your bike or cycle from the station.

column8:
Large double bedroom with private bathroom in quiet house.

Cleaned to an exceptionally high standard.

The house is located in the popular South Bristol area, within walking distance of North Street where you will find many shops and a huge variety of places to eat and drink.

Free on street parking.

Bristol Airport and Templemeads Station are easily accessible.
column9:
Quiet residential street, 10 minutes walk from the popular North Street, with many bars, restaurants and shops.

Wapping Wharf is a 25 minute walk away and has a vast selection of restaurants, cafes as well as independent shops.

On street free parking.

If you're in town for Business - we're ideally located for AXA, the BBC and the University of Bristol.
column9:
Clifton and the Whiteladies Road area of Bristol are packed with shops, restaurants, bars and cafes. Here some recommendations:
- Bosco Pizzeria
- Buenasado Argentine Steakhouse
- The Metropolitain
- Pizzarova
- Bravas

-
column16:
Hi! We’re Rhian and Will, the perfect blend of West Country guy meets South Wales girl. We got married 4 years ago and since then have been keeping ourselves busy with two kids, a hyper-active dog and a house renovation!

Our home on Grove Road was in need of some serious TLC when we took it on. It had been converted into offices back in the 1950’s and transforming it into a home suitable for family-living was no small task, especially at it’s a Listed Building with lots of beautiful features. The main house is currently rented out as it makes more sense for us to live closer to Rhian’s parents in Monmouth for now, however we kept the basement separate to use as a crash-pad. The reality is we haven’t managed to use it much and it’s a great space, so we thought why not try Airbnb? 

As we’re not currently living in Bristol and want our guests to have access to 24hr assistance we’ve asked the lovely people at Air 360 to manage it for us who are more than happy to help with anything that you might need.

We hope you will love the Studio as much as we do! It’s a fantastic base from which to explore Bristol.

column7: Stunning traditional flat in the heart of Bristol
column8: My apartment has been stylishly furnished, while bringing out the traditional features of a Georgian property. Having grown up in Zimbabwe I was inspired to bring a taste of the local culture to Bristol.  The place is ideally situated within walking distance of the city centre, Clifton and Gloucester road. There are many renowned restaurants, cafes and bars with a wide selection of cuisines.  We require guests to be very respectful of our neighbours and noise levels during their stay.
column9:
This is a lovely residential neighbourhood which is surprisingly quiet with its close proximity to the city centre.

Recommendations and the Local Area

•There is a small corner shop just a 2-minute walk from the flat. Perfect for any small amenities. Its called, Monica’s, on Cotham Road South.

•If you are looking for more there is a small supermarket called, The Co-Operative. It’s a 5-minute walk located on St Michaels Hill Road. You will also find some nice local pubs, bars and cafes along this street.

•To do a large shop there are two different Sainsbury’s, one on the triangle and the other on Whiteladies road.

•There is a Gym around the corner from the flat called, Everyone Active. They allow people to buy day passes for just £3 per day and have a good selection of walk-in classes.

Restaurants

•Areas such as, Clifton Village, White Ladies Road, The Triangle and Gloucester Road are best known for their sele
column16:
When traveling, I love the freedom and authentic experience that staying in an Airbnb gives you. It has always been my first choice of accommodation when my wife and I have explored many different regions around the World.

Another passion of ours developing old properties in a way that brings out the natural features, while adding stylish touches and modern day comforts. We have done this across Bath, Bristol and the Cotswolds. Each property has its own story and we are very happy to share this with anyone that would like to stay with us.

column8: This studio is situated in a fantastic location, close to Clifton Village and Clifton College, it is perfect for a couples getaway, a solo adventurer or business traveller.
column9:
The apartment is in a great location for Clifton college and the Clifton Suspension Bridge.This modern studio is perfectly situated in close proximity to:
-Clifton College- 1 minute walk
-The Downs - 1 minute walk
-Clifton Suspension Bridge - 3 minute drive
-Clifton Village (cafes, restaurants and shops)- 2 min walk
column16:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

column8: Property is not suitable for pets or babies/young children.  Limited use of kitchen by request. Residential area, a 2 minute walk to public transport.  Easy walk to leisure centre/swimming pool, Southmead hospital, shops/cafes.  Airbus, Rolls Royce, UWE short drive away.  Perfect for a break, visits to the theatre, nightlife, Cabot Circus, The Mall.  Ideal for visits to The Wave, Bath, Gloucester,  Slimbridge WWF and Berkeley Castle. column9: We live in a residential area.
column16:
We have been Scout Leaders for 30+ years and support the District team.  Our other hobbies:  I love walking, with friends or on my own - I have walked from Lands End to John O'Groats, Pennine Way, Pembrokeshire Coast Path, Two Moors Way, Coast to Coast; to name but a few.   I also love reading novels, fantasy, horror and auto-biographies.  I dream of completing any one of many knitting projects I have started.  My hubby, John enjoys building model boats and DIY.  He also loves reading,  historical novels and other books.  We both enjoy a wide variety of music from jazz to pop to classical.  We also enjoy a variety of food styles and dining out.  
My life motto would be - Always ask, as the answer is more often YES
John's life motto would be - Never give up

column8:
Recently developed 2-bedroom apartment (lower ground floor of our family home) in a great Clifton location. 2 mins walk to green spaces of The Clifton Downs in one direction & 5 mins to the bars, cafes and restaurants of Whiteladies Road in the other. A short walk to Clifton Village, Suspension Bridge, Bristol University, The BBC and Park Street - full listing of local places of interest below.

Easy access to Bristol City Centre, M4 & M5 motorways, trains & buses. 20 mins from Bristol airport.
column9:
A great location

There are so many great attractions within close proximity that it is impossible to list them all, but here are just a few that are within an easy walk, bike or bus. All of the places listed are within a 30-minute walk and many much closer. In addition to these attractions there are a great many restaurants and bars within a short walk. Some can get very busy so pre booking is advised:

-Clifton Durdham Downs
-Clifton Village
-Whiteladies Road and Park Street (Great restaurants and bars)
-Bristol Zoo
-University of Bristol and Halls of Residence
-Clifton Suspension Bridge
-Ashton Gate Stadium
-Gloucestershire County Cricket Ground
-The Memorial Stadium (Bristol Rovers)
-Brunel’s SS Great Britain
-BBC Bristol
-Ashton Court & Leigh Woods – great walking and mountain biking
-Clifton Lido
-Clifton Cathedral and Christ Church Clifton
-Hippodrome, Old Vic, the Tobacco Factory and Red

Based in Totterdown, a vibrant community which is easy walking distance to the centre, Whapping Wharf, Temple Meads train station with bars, cafes, supermarket, street art and several green spaces all close.

Perfect for a family friendly city stay.
column9: Totterdown is a brilliant vibrant creative community, with bars, restaurants, a greengrocer, high street supermarket and cafes all within walking distance.  Several lovely open green spaces (nearest park 3 min walk away) and a chilled atmosphere.

A short walk from some of the cities best sites, for shopping and sight seeing & just a stone’s throw from Stokes Croft the heart of buzzing and artsy Montpelier (Banksy’s hometown). column9: The flat is located in the city centre, just off the charming Portland Square. It is 5 minutes walk from Cabot Circus shopping centre, and 11 minute walk to Bristol Coach station and a 20 minute walk to Bristol Temple Meads raileay station. Its a 15 minute walk from the waterfront.

column7: MyCityHaven Stylish apartment edge of Cabot Circus
column8:
This 2nd floor apartment in central Bristol is a beautiful tranquil space overlooking historic Brunswick Square. It has a large double bedroom, luxury bathroom, plus an open plan living room and fully equipped kitchen with lots of natural light.
The bedroom has a king size bed, and the living has a double sofa bed. Cabot's Circus is literally across the road.
column9:
This is a perfect location on the edge of Cabot's Circus, with the lovely Brunswick Square just outside and the renowned Stokes Croft just a 2 minute walk away and Gloucester Rd a little further beyond that.

This means that you can indulge in all the shopping you want in Cabot's Circus as well as the many bars, restaurants, cafes and bistros in the area. If you'd like something a little less mainstream, venture into Stokes Croft and enjoy the many independent local shops, cafes, galleries, and the unending and ever changing street art scene.

Keep going and you'll reach Gloucester Rd, renowned as being the longest independent high street in Europe.

Independent studio room with own good shower room (across hallway) in the very popular BS6 / Gloucester Road area with its very many eateries, bars, and local shops. Short walk to city centre and many buses.
Free (but sometimes tight) street parking.
[Longer stay (at least 14 days) Guests are welcome to contact us more than three months in advance to request a booking]
column9:
Business class comfort and convenience in the very popular BS6 / Gloucester Road area. Walking distance from city centre (Cabot Circus 15 minutes, Harbour 20 minutes, Bear Pit/coach station 10 minutes). Free street parking.
Safe neighbourhood.
The studio is quite near Gloucester Road / Arches (2 minutes walk), a very popular area, the longest road of independent shops in the UK, also with many eateries to visit or order from within 2-5 minutes walk, also pubs, a very diverse range of shops, also post office, banks, supermarkets etc
column16:
My wife and I have busy professional jobs which have given us a great deal of experience over the years with many types of people, different cultural settings and nationalities. We also own property which we let to young professionals and have had extensive experience both with lodgers and tenants (over 150 contracts); and with property development and maintenance. An overview, including testimonials, can be viewed at www bristolpad co uk. We are recognized for being efficient and pro-active in ensuring that the accommodation we provide is of high standard and well maintained. We are NLA and ICO registered. 
The BristolPad Studio flat described here represents a development which we feel will be attractive both for business and holiday travellers to the Bristol area. It is our second studio for short term letting / managed apartments (see also Avonview Studio BS4 4AW which has over 50 feedbacks) and we are committed to ensuring that we provide a high standard of service. We also have excellent local contacts and contractors to support our services.

A small built-in cupboard equipped with hangers.

column9:
Welcome to one of the most beautiful parts of Bristol. Nestled between Berkeley Square and Brandon Hill, this city centre location is idyllic. With birds singing songs throughout the day and the hustle & bustle of Queen’s Road and Park Street there couldn’t be a better location to discover Bristol.
Brandon Hill is a wonderful place to get lost in and enjoy nature at its best (in your own backyard!). Discover its waterfalls, woodland and meadow. There's a playground too and the paths lead you all the way down to the river Avon and the centre of town.
Park Street is filled with independent clothing stores, charity shops, and the original Boston Tea Party coffee shop. Try out Pinkman’s, a modern bakery and cafe. There are plenty of wonderful bakeries, cafes, restaurants, and the great Bristol Museum is over the road. Swoon at the bottom of Park Street is an absolute must if you are a lover of Italian gelato.

column8:
Please DO NOT RESERVE before discussing with me.

Eclectic mix of traditional and modern in this Victorian era home. I enjoy meeting people from all parts of the world and all backgrounds, the only requirement is mutual respect, consideration and a peaceful nature. Also see my other listing, 'Peaceful Safe Home and Clear Space. One of the few places in Bristol where you can still park for free.
column9: Located in the cosmopolitan and bohemian community of Greenbank, Easton. Free on street parking. Excellent local food shops that sell a wide range of quality foods, cool cafe's and restaurants, providing a range of different cultural cuisine, ie Thali, Moroccan, Indian, Vegan, great coffee at Cafe 5 etc. Good public transport service provides a short ride to city center and other surrounding areas .. A local train service within walking distance trains to: Temple Meads Train Station, Clifton, Redland, Gloucester rd and Bath etc. Plus bus services. The Bristol to Bath railway path, is great for both cyclists and pedestrians and is right on our doorstep. Green spaces and lovely parks in walking distance.
column16: So far I've really enjoyed the experience of hosting the varied and interesting selection of people who have visited my home. I'm calm and friendly, respectful, easy to get along with person. When I travel, I like to stay in places that offer me privacy and space but helpful and friendly if I need anything. I like a clean, clear space, that I can call my own, so I aim to offer the same to my guests, I'm also open to a friendly chat and cuppa if you need that. I'm told people feel relaxed and at ease in my company. I am well traveled including time spent in West Africa and Europe. I've lived in Central and South America and the Caribbean. I love the arts and culture, I'm a practicing writer, photographer and therapist. I love music and dancing and for many years I worked alongside world music artists, working and traveling with artists from all over the world; I think this has given me a broad understanding, appreciation and acceptance of different people and different customs. I relate well to others and am told by people who have limited grasp of the english language that my spoken english and diction is clear and easy to understand. I speak a little spanglish! I like walking, nature and yoga.

column7: Very Central 2 Bed Loft Apartment- Self Check In
column8:
Meters from the centre of Bristol, this loft apartment is modern, bright a spacious. It has two double bedrooms, excellent bathroom and open plan living/dining/kitchen.
The apartment has views over the historic city of Bristol and is situated among the bars, restaurants and shops of the Old City Quarter.
There is no car parking, and no road access after 10am Monday to Friday. The nearest car park is the NCP on Nelson Street
Parties will be shut down, so please don't.
column9:
Central Bristol is a vibrant area withany local bars and restaurants, chains and independent retailers.
The city has been voted the beat place to live in the UK may times. It is a cosmopolitan city, with many different nationalities and cultures calling it home.
Embrace the small city lifestyle and walk or cycle to where you need to go.
column16:
Two kids, two dogs, one VW T4. Proud Bristolian.
I live very close to the properties listed, so in the unlikely event of a problem (or a noise complaint) I can be with you within minutes.

column8:
Welcome to our light and spacious warehouse apartment, situated in the heart of Bristol's historic Harbourside. Only a short walk from the main railway station, the apartment is nestled on a quiet backwater street with minimal traffic, yet still within easy reach of bustling waterfront restaurants and pubs.

The entire duplex apartment is yours to enjoy, complete with its own private entrance and a balcony offering views across the city and the Floating Harbour.
column9:
From the apartment you can walk to all the harbourside and city centre attractions including the SS Great Britain, M Shed, Millenium Square, The Old Vic Theatre, The Hippodrome, Colston Hall, The University, St Nick’s Market and the main shopping area.

A longer walk takes you up the hill to Cabot Tower and to Clifton Village. Close by there are a wide selection of places to eat and drink including local pubs, harbourside cafes and restaurants including the Michelin Star Casa Mia Restaurant.
column16: I have lived in and around Bristol since 1982. I am married to John and have two grown up sons. I recently retired from Local Government and John is an Architect. I love nature, yoga and cycling and like to visit new places as often as I can. We have a converted warehouse in the heart of the city that we make available to visitors to Bristol.

column8: Large double bedroom & ensuite in fabulous modern, spacious, warm, clean, bright and pet-free townhouse in central harbour. Perfect location for train station and city-centre without party/traffic noise/fumes. Surrounded by historic harbour.  'Quiet house' after 11pm. Ideal for work visits & considerate travellers.
column9: This is the peaceful, residential section of the harbour area, no traffic, no club or party noise. Most of the harbour area is buzzing and therefore noisy, but we are in a lovely quiet section around Bathhouse Basin, which is a mini-marina. We have the UK's 'best restaurant' on our doorstep - Casamia, beat 1200 others to be top of Gordon Ramsay's competition list.  It's a conservation area with beautiful character buildings all around. It's perfectly placed for Temple Meads Station, the city centre and the thriving business quarter around the station.
column16: I work in education, as a filmmaker and writer.  I live and work from home so am usually there to greet and assist when needed. column8: Wonderful spacious and tastefully furnished Garden floor apartment, in Grade II listed Georgian House (with off street parking), within easy walking distance from both the Whiteladies and Gloucester Roads and their restaurants (hipster street food to fine dining), shops and coffee hangouts.  Located right in the middle of the City, near the hospital, University, Clifton, Chandos Road - yet set within the leafy green tranquility and space of Cotham Park.
column9:
Lovely leafy Georgian neighbourhood, set up high with views over the whole of Bristol. An extremely central location, Cotham neighbours, Stokes Croft (hipster coffee shops and bars) and Kingsdown (beautiful architecture) on one side, and Clifton (Beautiful Village next to the Downs) on the other.

Extremely central with easy access by foot, bus or bike to; shopping in Cabots Circus, culture at the Arnolfini/M Shed and Harbourside/Waterfront - music/theatre at the Colston Hall/Hippodrome/Everyman cinema. Close-by to the BBC, BRI Hospital and Bristol University. Lovely walks on the Downs.

Our nearest park with children's play area, is Cotham Gardens - a few minutes walk down the road.
column16: We met in our early 20's at Edinburgh University and worked our way around the world mostly hitchhiking, washing dishes and working on organic farms before settling down to careers in Marketing and Creative Media. column9: Right in the heart of Bristol,  the city centre is lively and full of Bristol's rich history. Just up the road you will find park street and clifton, home to some of Bristol's most popular independent shops, bars and cafes. At the top of Park street you will find Bristol museum & art gallery and Wills memorial building, and at the bottom of Park street is the impressive Bristol Cathedral- perfect sightseeing spots practically on your doorstep! Why not take a walk through St Nicholas market which is full of culture and fantastic food, or walk into Cabot Circus, Bristol's central shopping centre, for a bit of retail therapy! There are plenty of green spaces if you'd prefer a nice walk and some fresh air- queen's square is right next door and nearby you will find brandon hill, castle park and many more. Bristol harbourside is the perfect place for foodies (lots of choice!) and art & culture lovers- we recommend M-shed, watershed, and Spike island. No matter what kind of break you are look

column9:
Welcome to Southville, Bristol! This vibrant neighbourhood is a delightful mix of history, culture, and community spirit. Its colourful Victorian terraced houses and charming streets create a picturesque atmosphere.

Southville also has diverse culinary options, with a wide range of restaurants along North Street . Additionally, just a short distance away is Whapping Wharf, a vibrant waterfront district known for its fantastic dining scene. Here, you'll find a variety of restaurants all with views of the harbour.

Southville is also home to the Tobacco Factory Theatre, a cultural hub hosting various performances including theatre, dance, comedy, and live music. It is located in a beautifully restored tobacco warehouse, which adds to its unique charm. Don't miss the Sunday market at the Tobacco Factory, where you can explore local crafts, artisanal goods, and indulge in delicious street food.

For museum enthusiasts, Bristol offers a wealth of options. Jus
column16: Hello, I'm Sam and I live in Southville with my partner Rob and our two teenage sons. We also have two cats who like to hang around the front garden waiting for strokes from passers by and a friendly Labrador.

column8:
This Victorian apartment is spacious, bright and elegant with large windows, high ornate ceilings, chandeliers in each room and wood floors adorned with handmade Afghan rugs. Both bedrooms have a Super king-size mahogany bed and a sumptuous handmade mattress with Egyptian cotton bedding. The bathrooms boasts a deep bathtub, walk-in shower, under-floor heating, and all the usual towels and toiletries provided.
Guests have access to the entire apartment and all amenities and shared front garden.
column9:
Please note: Free parking available for one vehicle only.
This home is on a quiet and leafy street, located between Whiteladies Road and Clifton Village. Cotham Hill and Chandos Road are both within walking distance, and some of Bristol's best restaurants can be found there. Durdham Downs is also close.
column16: I feel very lucky to have lived in Bristol for over 17 years and regard it as one of the most interesting and dynamic cities in the UK. I am a wildlife cameraman and have been travelling the world for over 30 years. I spend a great deal of time in wild places but always relish the hustle and bustle of city life when I come home. My day is not complete without a walk around the beautiful Clifton Downs. The Clifton Lido and Everyman cinema are minutes away and are just a couple of gems that make living in Bristol such a joy.

The house is modern and has a stylish décor. It has a small but charming garden, three bedrooms and a shower on the first floor, kitchen, bathroom, and lounge on the ground floor. The lounge forms a private sleeping area should groups visiting require four rooms.

The house is suitable for both leisure and business visits to Bristol. It is freshly decorated and well optimised for up to 8 guests, with comfortable beds for resting after a long day.
column9:
Centre of town is a short 10 minutes drive away or a 25 minutes bus ride.
Harbourside - Boats, restaurants and museums are perfect for both professional and leisure use.

Cabot Circus – a semi-indoor shopping area filled with popular retail shops, restaurants, and cinema, great for families.

Stokes Croft – a taste of true Bristol flavour of life, where you can find great pubs, graffiti and delicious restaurants.

St George Park – amazing for a lovely walk or picnic with a pond for a feature in the park. Ice cream vans are often around the skate park area, providing something for everybody in a family.

column7: City centre, 2 bedroom with garden on Portland sq
column8:
Situated on the stunning Portland Square an ideal location if working or exploring the city. Just minutes from restaurants & shops in Cabot Circus & Stokes Croft famous for street art. The Harbour & Whapping Wharf are just a short stroll

Each double bedroom overlook a private courtyard that has festoon lights, seating. Recently repainted with new bed & linen & art from local artists inc Inkie

Kitchen with SMEG appliances, fast fibre Wifi. VIRGIN TV package inc docs and drama. Netflix
column9:
Portland square is one of Bristol’s oldest squares so it’s really pretty. The square is a park which is a great place to relax. On the square there is church that is lit up at night and is now a circus school and events space. Behind the church you can find a children’s park. The location is very quiet although you are in the city centre.

The shopping centre where there is a cinema & restaurants Cabot Circus is 1 minute walk from my apartment. Sainsbury’s supermarket is 2 minutes away via Cabot Circus.

St. Paul’s and Stokes Croft are really trendy areas with lots of cafes, bars and street art. Castle Park and the waterfront is less than 5 minute walk and you can walk to the harbour in under 10 minutes via the artist quarter of The Christmas Steps.
column16:
I’m Bristolian so feel free to ask for recommendations for places to visit and where to eat 

The whole apartment & garden is available exclusively. Please note my cat and I no longer live in the apartment. 

The apartment is in the perfect location for exploring the city on foot & has many great places for food and drink nearby including the Artist Residence Hotel next door who serve great coffee, cocktails & brunch.

column8: Double room & private ensuite in fabulous modern, spacious, warm, clean, bright and pet-free townhouse in central harbour. Includes quality self-serve breakfast in lovely kitchen with terrace and views. 100% cotton starched/pressed linen. Parking available. Work ready inc desk. Peaceful conservation area. Perfect location for train station and city-centre without party/traffic noise/fumes. Surrounded by historic harbour.  Quiet house after 11pm. Ideal for work visits & considerate travellers.
column9: This is the peaceful, residential section of the harbour area, no traffic, no club or party noise. Most of the harbour area is buzzing and therefore noisy, but we are in a lovely quiet section around Bathhouse Basin, which is a mini-marina. We have the UK's 'best restaurant' on our doorstep - Casamia, beat 1200 others to be top of Gordon Ramsay's competition list.  It's a conservation area with beautiful character buildings all around. It's perfectly placed for Temple Meads Station, the city centre and the thriving business quarter around the station.
column16: I work in education, as a filmmaker and writer.  I live and work from home so am usually there to greet and assist when needed. I have been doing airbnb since September 2017 and am now adding my second spare bedroom to my offer.  I hope to welcome all kinds of friendly and considerate travellers and business people to my home in this lovely part of Bristol.

column7: City of Bristol Home with a View
column8: A beautiful 1 bedroom flat with period features and views across Bristol. A stones throw from the cafes and bars of bustling Stokes Croft, a 10 minute walk to the independent shops of Gloucester Road and a 5 minute walk to Cabot Circus, for shopping & town centre.  A light open plan kitchen / living space, well equiped to cook an evening meal and a window seat from which to enjoy the views. The large dark walled bedroom feels cosy with orignal shutters that open on to a quiet street.
column9: We live in a quiet corner of a very vibrant area. The immediate neighbourhood of Cotham offers some of Bristols most beautiful streets and views. With a very short walk down the hill there is Stokes Croft and Montpelier which is home to Bristol's cultural quarter, outdoor gallery and celebrated restaurants, cafes and bars. Within a 10 minute walk you can reach St Pauls, traditionally Bristol's Jamaican quarter and St Werburghs, home of City farm and the pioneering self build communities and Gloucester Road, hoasting more independent shops than any other street in Britain. Other areas of interest and within a 25 minute walk are Clifton, with its fine architecture, charming lido, iconic bridge and views across the gorge; And the harbourside, perfect for a stroll, with waterside restaurants, bars and market, home to Arnol fini and Millenium Square and a wealth of maritime history.
column16: My name is Anna, I live in Bristol with my partner Matt and our daughter Eva, before Bristol I was screen printing in London and am currently trying to work out whats next after being full time mum for the last couple of years! I love making and creating and the great outdoors but with a penchant for the creature comfits of city life!

column7: Light single bedroom Victorian house nr University
column8: Beautiful single bedroom in a quiet Victorian terrace. Luxury bedding with top of the range mattress ensures a comfortable stay.  The house is a short walk both to Whiteladies Road famous for its variety of independent cafes, pubs and shops, superb location for the University which is just a lovely 10 minutes walk, and 25 minutes to the Harbourside.  Off street parking is available.  Good public transport to the centre and other areas by bus/train a short walk away. Continental breakfast.
column9:
You are within walking distance of The Downs (15 minutes), Whiteladies Road (6 minutes), the University (10 minutes), a lovely park (6 minutes), Gloucester Road (15 minutes) and Clifton (20 minutes). The city centre is also a short 20 minute walk, and the University is only round the corner, 10minutes walking distance.

Additionally, you are surrounded by great transport links (Clifton Down Station, Redland Station and numerous bus stops) taking you wherever you would like around the city.
column16: Hello I moved to Bristol 5 years ago with my husband. We are absolutely enchanted both with the city and the convenient location of our home that we tend with loving care. I was born in Mexico and my husband in South Africa. We have lived in Latin America, Continental Europe and Asia for much of our life; before Bristol, in Thailand, travelling widely across Asia. We thrive on meeting people from a wide range of cultures in a welcoming home.

Beaufort House is located in Clifton on leafy roads. Close to Clifton Village, Whiteladies Road, Clifton Suspension Bridge and the Zoo.
Off-road parking is available (needs to be booked separately) and then is also on-street permitted parking during the day.

column7: Revamped Flat in Georgian Heritage Home
column8:
Refurbished to a high standard, this beautiful, fully equipped apartment is perfect for a weekend away sightseeing, or for longer stays.

The apartment's private entrance is accessed via a small courtyard to the front of the flat.

The large open plan kitchen, dining and sitting room are at the heart of the apartment. The kitchen is fully equipped with Miele appliances - electric hob, oven, microwave, fridge/freezer and Nespresso machine and there’s a washer/dryer for those wishing to stay a bit longer.

The adjoining sitting room includes Samsung flat screen TV with Freesat. The property has WiFi throughout.

The large bedroom to the rear of the apartment includes a super comfy, king size bed including bedding.

The bathroom has underfloor heating, large walk in shower, luxurious toiletries and towels.

A car parking space is available during your stay, giving you freedom to explore further into the beautiful West Country.
column9: Many of Bristol’s tourist attractions are within walking distance: the museum, zoo, Hippodrome theatre, aquarium, Victoria Room, and more. Clifton village is a 5 minute stroll offering a range of boutique shops, restaurants, and coffee shops.

column8: The higgihaus@century place (#23) is a beautifully appointed one-bedroom apartment a stone's throw from Bristol's premier central shopping quarter.
column9: higgihaus@century place (#23) is a mere stone's throw from Bristol's premier shopping quarter, Cabot Circus. Chock full of shops, restaurants, coffee shops, leisure facilities (including a cinema and gym) and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including parking). A few yards in the other direction you're in Portland Square - a Grade 1 listed square that was laid out in the early 18th century as one of Bristol's first suburbs. At the square's heart is an area laid to grass, perfect for a moment or two's contemplation before getting stuck into your day.
column16:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.

column7: Bright, book-filled flat in artsy Stokes Croft
column8: Come and be apart of Stokes Croft life whilst staying in a comfortable, bright and book-filled flat positioned in a vibrant setting amongst Bristol life - just a stones throw from some of the most popular amenities the city has to offer. There is an abundance of cafes, bars, restaurants, independent shops and street art in short walking distance in local communities such as St. Pauls, Stokes Croft, Montpelier and renowned Harbourside.
column9: Nestled between the arty district of Montpelier and vibrant St Paul's (known for its annual carnival), you'll never be short of things to see and do around here. With incredible coffee culture, food, live music and art right on your doorstep (be sure to check out the Banksy just a short stroll from the flat). I'll be sure to leave some guides to the local area to help you make the most of your visit.

column7: King Room above a friendly funky pub.
column8: Comfortable King above The Dark Horse pub. We specialise in real ale, craft ale and local ciders. We have a great organic Sunday lunch each week. Guests can self check in however there is usually someone about to help with any local knowledge, bus routes, etc. 11am check out
column9:
We are close to a beautiful Victorian park -St Georges, perfect if you have a dog.
3 doors down from the pub we have the highly acclaimed restaurant The Lock up, who do a great brunch as well as ‘the’ place to go for dinner. Church rd is bustling and has a plethora of great independent cafes, a delicatessen, an award winning bakery and multiple supermarkets and convenience stores.
We are 10 minutes walk from Easton and The plough pub, Greenbank and the wonderful foodie shopping experience that is Sweetmart.

column7: Cosy Victorian home 10 min bus Bristol city centre
column8:
Welcome to my lovely, warm, light-filled, Victorian house in vibrant, multi-cultural, Bristol; a mile+ from the city.

*strong WIFI
* dedicated workspace
* free on street parking
* large well equipped kitchen and dining space
* sunny courtyard garden
*cosy bedroom with bathrobes and hairdryer

You're welcome to use my well-equipped kitchen/ living/dining-room with lots of cookery books and board games .

Cafes, restaurants, shops + public transport are minutes away.
column9:
Easton is a multi-cultural part of inner city Bristol with its own little high street. It's about a 25 minute walk into the City Centre.
Known for it's strong sense of community, wide variety of cafes, shops and restaurants from Brazilian and Indian to Afro-Carribbean and African, vibrant music scene and lovely open spaces.
Like many inner city areas undergoing regeneration it can be a little scruffy around the edges.
column16:
Warm, friendly, well-travelled. 

Happy to chat to guests over a cup of tea or glass of wine. 

Sometimes they'll be a homemade cake, bread or a dish for you to try. 

I offer a tour around the local area & tips and advice on places to visit/see in Bristol and further afield.

Love Bristol for its vibrant festival, music, arts and food scene.

Travel whenever I can - recent visits to Morocco and Spain

My partner stays overnight sometimes.

column8: Characterful Victorian townhouse in cosmopolitan Montpellier with stunning panoramic views over Bristol. A stones throw from vibrant Stokes Croft with plentiful independent cafes, bars and restaurants.
column9: Montpelier is a vibrant area with plenty of independent cafes, shops and restaurants. Easy access to Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road with its street art and quirky architecture. 15 minute walk into the city centre. 5 minute walk to Montpelier train station. Montpelier was voted the trendiest neighbourhood in the UK.

Newly refurbished apartment with high ceilings in a Grade II listed Georgian terrace. column9: It is a quiet residential road,  and a 4 minute walk to the Triangle, 8 minutes to Clifton Village, etc..
column16: I run a software company which provides to the NHS and healthcare market.  We spent two years renovating our house and developing the basement flat, and have now been proud AirBnB Hosts for five years! :-)

column8:
Spacious modern apartment.

This comfortable apartment located on a street in the heart of Bristol City Centre, just a 2 minute walk from the vibrant Stokes Croft area and 5 minute walk from Cabot Circus shopping centre. It's a perfect base to allow you to see everything Bristol has to offer.

This apartment would also be well suited for family breaks offering two bedrooms with double beds as welll as a travel cot and high chair available on request for mini members of the family.
column9: Based in Bristol City Centre the apartment is a stones throw away from the trendy Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road area with its vintage shops and busy nightlife.

column7: 3 bedroom Shirehampton flat near Avonmouth & M4
column8:
A first floor apartment in Shirehampton, Bristol which is easily accessible from Avonmouth, the M4 and Bristol and is a welcoming, comfy space. The kitchen is fully equipped and there is a comfy living room with smart TV. The 3 bedrooms have comfy beds and bathroom has a bath and shower above.
Parking is free on street
column9:
Local attractions include Blaise Castle Estate and Kingsweston House. Just a short drive along the Portway, passing under the famous Clifton suspension bridge takes you to the heart of the City, with all its many attractions including the International balloon fiesta and Festival of the Seas.
The property is located near to the M4 and M5 junctions so is an ideal base for exploring the Southwest.

column8:
Welcome to the attic room! It is close the city centre, Temple Meads train station, the IELTS test venue and handy for visiting Bath, Wells and Glastonbury.

It is a bright, spacious and relaxed space with great views across Bristol. The Victorian terrace house is on a quiet residential street, 2 minutes walk from a bus stop.

The room has a comfortable double bed and a sofa bed; a table; strong wifi signal; a TV (including Netflix); an Apple speaker as well as coffee and assorted teas.
column9:
The house is close to the city centre and handy for exploring what Bristol has to offer. Bristol Temple Meads train station is a short bus ride away. It is also handy for Bath, Wells, Glastonbury, The Paintworks, Sandy Park, Arnos Vale, HTV studios, Brislington, Totterdown, Broomhill, St Anne’s and Knowle areas.

The house is just situated just off Sandy Park Road (2 minute walk) which has a host of amenities including a cafe/bar, convenience stores, a bakers, a butchers, a pharmacy, a post office (which has banking facilities and a bureau de change), a couple of ATMs, a delicatessen, an excellent fish and chip shop, a chinese takeaway and a sewing shop! Sainsbury's supermarket is 10 min walk away.

Avonmead's retail park is close by, which is handy for the cinema, M&S Food Hall, Mcdonalds, KFC, Costa Coffee etc.

There are a couple of parks near by. The Nightingale Valley nature reserve and woodland walk is a few minutes away. The historic cemetery at

column9: We are fabulously located in the north of Bristol. It is located 1 min walk from the famous Gloucester Road, which is one of the largest High Streets in the UK and has the most independent shops of any street in the country. It is packed with great places to eat and drink, listen to music and party. Walk for 30-40 mins down the Gloucester Road and you will be in Bristol City Center. There are also buses every few minutes. Bristol Rovers and Gloucester Cricket Ground are both a short walk. Beautiful Clifton and the Clifton Suspension Bridge is a nearby. We are also very close to Filton, which is home to many businesses including; Airbus, Rolls Royce and the MOD.

column9: The flat is in a wonderful neighbourhood, with a great selection of independent shops, bars and restaurants on the doorstep and an Everyman cinema around the corner on Whiteladies Road. The Lido is also just a couple of minutes walk away, with its spa, poolside bar and award winning restaurant. We are moments away from both an M&S Food Hall and a much larger Sainsbury's. The vast expanse of the Downs, with stunning views of the Avon Gorge and Brunel's landmark Suspension Bridge, are a short walk away, as well as the charming Clifton Village. The University of Bristol, Park Street, Brandon Hill Park, the Docks and Harbourside are also within easy walking distance, and Bristol Airport is a short 20 minute car journey away.

Take a break in Brandon Hill Nature Park A wildlife haven right in the city centre, this nature park is an ideal place for jogging or walking (or just laying on your back in the grass). column8:
Location is very close to the city centre, for tourism, shopping and business.

Tourism; easy walking, harbourside, boats, restaurants and museums for both professional and recreational use.

Cabot Circus is only 15 minutes walk, Stokes Croft 20 minutes walk, home of multi-cultural restaurants, pubs, galleries and graffiti.

Parking is Free.
column9:
St Werburgh's is a thriving community with a high street that reflects the Bristolian spirit with its tasteful murals, cafes, breweries, and popular park. The house is just steps away from the local community centre which houses the cosy Neck of the Woods Cafe. Here, you can get excellent tea and coffee with good food (including cake)!

Tesco Extra is just a 15 minute walk or 6 minute drive away.

For the adventurous, two popular and well known climbing centres are within a 5 minute walk of the house.

column7: The Robinson Building, converted Victorian factory
column8:
The Robinson building is an old paper bag factory in the heart of Bristol which has been converted into bright and modern apartments. Featuring high ceilings and windows as well as thick brick walls you really feel as though you are living in a part of local history.

Situated in the vibrant Bedminster and Southville areas there is plenty to see and do on your doorstep and the center of town and harbourside are just a short walk away.
column9:
The Bedminster area is steeped in history and is a culturally vibrant hotspot. On the doorstep is East street which has convenience of common high street shops as well as a supermarket.

In the other direction is North Street with lots of independent shops, some stunning street art from Upfest (Europes largest street art festival) and Ashton Gate the home of Bristol City FC and Bristol Bears Rugby.

Whichever direction you head in there is also a cafe or pub to whet your whistle and it is only a short walk into town and the historic harbourside area, which is home to the SS Great Britain.

column7: Lovely flat near Bristol City Centre!
column8:
This simple apartment sleeps four and is ideal for easy access into Bristol City Centre, whether on foot or by car. Located a 15 minute drive from Temple Meads Train Station and a great location for a shopping trip as it is only a 5 minute drive or 15 minute walk to Cabot Circus Shopping Centre.

It is a 7 minute drive or 25 minute walk into central Bristol, please view the map on the listing to see the location. A perfect base for a trip to Bristol.
column9:
Located in St Agnes & Montpelier Throughout the area are beautifully painted houses and street art side-by-side, the Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is often the first introduction to the area for visitors

Picton Street is really the spine of Montpelier with a number of little shops and cafes, just located off the thoroughfare of Stokes Croft. At the top end there is the always busy Bristolian café, which is great for people watching and brunch.

Close by is also Mina road filled with Breweries, restaurants and cafes. Visit Danny's burgers at the Fierce and Noble breweries for the best voted burger in Bristol.

There are a number of little pubs found within Montpelier, which you wouldn’t know existed if you kept to the main strips.

At the top of the list is The Cadbury, which has the best beer garden in this part of town and does brilliant Sunday roasts, with all meat supplied by Popti & Beast (a butcher based down in St.Werburghs, whi

column7: Luxury Urban Shepherd’s Hut, multi-night discounts
column8: Cosy Shepherd’s Hut only a 15 minute walk from Bristol Temple Meads station and the airport flyer bus stop. Cute kitchen & bathroom, underfloor heating & wood burner. A little haven of peace in a bustling urban setting. The Bus stop at the end of the road takes you into the city centre. N.B. The bed folds into the wall to reveal a lovely table/seating area - see below for more information about this.
column9: Totterdown is a creative, trendy area of Bristol with popular bars, pubs and restaurants in walking distance. It boasts some of the best views over Bristol including panoramas of Clifton suspension bridge, Ashton Court estate and the city centre. There are several well maintained park spaces only a few minutes walk away. Please ask us for recommendations.

column8:
Modern apartment located in the beautiful Portland Square in the centre of Bristol. Equipped with everything you'd hope to find in a home away from home and perfectly located for exploring what Bristol has to offer.

Free on-street parking is available in the local area on weekends and between 5pm-9am Monday to Friday. Between 9am-5pm Monday to Friday the local area is permit-holders only with the closest free parking available approximately 10 minutes walk away - please message me for details.
column9:
The flat is located on Portland Square which is a beautiful Grade 1 listed 18th century square, itself located in the heart of vibrant St Paul's and minutes from the city centre.

Stokes Croft, known as Bristol's cultural quarter, is just a five minutes walk away and offers a range of independent businesses including cafes, bars and nightclubs, as well as street art including works from Banksy.

Cabot Circus is also just five minutes walk away and is Bristol's main shopping precinct offering a range of restaurants as well as shops and entertainment.

The rest of Bristol's city centre, including the Old City, the Harbourside, the Cathedral and the University are just 15-20 minutes walk away.

With easy access to Temple Meads train station and the M32. Ideal location to see the best of everything Bristol has to offer!
column9:
With a rich history spanning centuries, Bristol’s modern day Old Market/Barton Vale district has a unique character built from its vibrant residents and businesses alike. You will discover an eclectic blend of vintage stores and independent shops mixed with cool cafés, bars and restaurants as well as art and music venues. On its doorstep, the bustling bars, cafés, theatres and shops of the city centre are all within easy reach and the renowned Cabot Circus shopping centre is just a short walk away.

Bristol is renowned for its rich heritage and vibrant culture. Birthplace of ‘Banksy’ and home to Brunel’s Clifton Suspension Bridge, Bristol plays host to the Bristol Harbour Festival and Bristol International Balloon Fiesta annually, bringing excitement and colour to this already thriving modern city.

Local recommendations:

-The Barley Mow pub is ran by Bristol Beer Factory and has 8 cask and 10 keg lines showcasing the best beer as well as a food menu incl

column8: Welcome to my apartment near Bristol's world famous Harbourside where you will feel comfortably at home and experience the city like a true local.
column9:
Southville is a popular, trendy Bristol neighbourhood, situated between the River Avon on one side and vibrant North Street shops on the other.
Some of the best places to eat: Sunny Stores, the Spotted Cow; Ashville steakhouse the Souk Kitchen; El Rincón; the Old Bookshop; the North Street Standard and the Hen & Chicken (pub and comedy venue) Tobacco Factory Theatre and market - all on North Street. East Street is not quite as well served, but does have Viva La Mexicana and a new vegan restaurant, Vx. On West Street is the family-run Mezzaluna (Mediterranean).
column16: Originally from Birmingham then via London, I moved to Bristol two years ago with my second husband. We have five grown up daughters between us, so very family-orientated.  We enjoy travel and now prefer comfort where we stay so I have made this a top priority with my apartments, too. Since moving here, we have immersed ourselves in our vibrant and varied local community, largely through setting up choirs which naturally have led to wonderful new friendships! We've found Bristol to be a welcoming, exciting city and hope you will, too.

column7: Contemporary Home in Friendly Easton, Free Parking
column8:
We've just finished renovating our lovely home in Easton and would be delighted to host you while you explore Bristol.

With excellent transport links, both business and leisure travellers alike will be perfectly placed to get around. We have everything you could need to have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. Our house is handily located in a rare free parking zone!
column9: Excellent transport links, both business and leisure travellers alike will be perfectly placed to get around
column16: We feel our place is an ideal base from which to explore this fabulous city. It’s a short hop to the city centre (ask for a three-stop hop on any local bus and you’ll be in Cabot Circus in no time). We have free on-street parking right outside our door, so you don’t have to worry about pay and display or the parking permits which now place restrictions on motorists in many other parts of the city. If you don’t have a car, that’s no problem, as there is a regular bus into town that stops on our street, or you can take the train from Stapleton Road station and be at Temple Meads or Clifton in no time. If you like a good walk, you can get to Broadmead in around 40 minutes by following the Bristol and Bath Railway Path into town. However, if you want to feel like a real Bristolian, the preferred way to get about Britain’s first ‘cycling city’ is by bike, of course. Our house is handily located next to the Bristol and Bath Railway Path, so why not bring your bikes? The ride to Bath through the Avon Valley is stunningI am a Bristolian born and raised; my wife and I met here at university. Bristol really is a beautiful city. We love taking walks around the Floating Harbour, ensuring we take time to stop for coffee at the Olive Shed, a swift half at the Nova Scotia Hotel, or maybe even a delicious bite to eat at the containers on Wapping Wharf. We also enjoy taking in the stunning views from the top of Brandon Hill before checking out the quirky, artsy shops on Park Street. We always like to look in at the Boston Tea Party on Park Street, where the ‘secret garden’ provides perfect respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. We’ve owned our house in Easton since July 2019. Recently voted one of the top 50 coolest neighbourhoods in the world by TimeOut Magazine (September 2019), Easton really does have something for everyone. You will find trendy cafés selling excellent coffee and home-made cakes, world-beating curry restaurants, and plenty of friendly local boozers. We like to visit the gorgeous Este Kitchen for coffee and brunch. Just opposite, the Greenbank pub is a great spot for lunch or an evening pint or two; their guest ales change all the time and they have a decent selection of board games. If you’re planning a quiet night in, G Bros Pizza will do you a perfectly baked pizza. The M’Sala Library truly is one of the best curries I’ve ever eaten; be sure to ask for the vegetable samosas which are to die for. For the discerning foodie, the famous Bristol Sweet Mart on St Mark’s Road is a five-minute walk away. There you’ll find ingredients for sale from all four corners of the globe. Worth a trip, even just for a browse. We look forward to hosting you soon in beautiful BS5. Chris, Justine and baby Louis.

column9: The best of Bristol’s Harbourside Fill your belly or fix your bike at Mud Dock Café Run by ex-graphic designers with a love of cycling and eating, this bike shop-cum-restaurant is a one-stop-shop if you’re keen on either passtime. Take a break in Brandon Hill Nature Park A wildlife haven right in the city centre, this nature park is an ideal place for jogging or walking (or just laying on your back in the grass). Get a cider education at The Apple One of Bristol’s most legendary bars, this converted Dutch barge sells a tongue-tantalising range of cider and perry from the West Country and beyond. Work out whenever at Puregym Bristol Harbourside Pick up a day pass for this 24/7 gym packed with quality kit ranging from free weights to cardio machines. There’s 50 fitness classes a week, too.

column9:
This is a vibrant area of Bristol. Easy walking access to Whiteladies Road and Gloucester Road, on which you can find a variety of bars, restaurants, supermarkets, cinema...

Cotham Hill is a pedestrian street with great restaurants and bars.

Near the university. It is a very quiet area although eventually you can hear students passing by during the freshers week.

Short 5 min taxi ride from the coach station.

5 min walking to Redland train station, which takes you to Bristol Temple Meads (main train station) in 15 min.

Parking is a resident parking zone but I can activate a visitor parking permit for you if needed.

column9:
This is in the great neighbourhood of Easton, with local parks and bustling streets moments away.

With the popular St Marks Road around the corner, you'll find plenty of choice for eating or takeout, like Dela (incredible Swedish inspired bowl food), Thali Cafe (award winning Indian restaurant and Eco Tiffin takeaway), the East Bristol Bakery (real bread, no preservatives, lots of Sourdough) and loads more (No. 12, Este Kitchen, Greenbank Pub and so on).

For groceries there's the generation-spanning behemoth Bristol Sweet Mart, selling all kinds of incredible produce from around the world, or Matter Whole Foods which does all things organic.

Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

column9:

There's lots to enjoy!

column9:
Located in St Agnes, only a short 15 minute walk to the trendy, cultrally diverse, virbant area of Stokes Croft which is always buzzing with activity. Here you will find plenty of bars, restaurants and a number of local events throughout the year.

Walking Distance from the property:
-The Duke of York Pub: 3 min walk
-Fierce & Noble: Craft Brewery: 5 min walk
-Napolita Cafe: Great breakfast & Italian food: 7 minute walk
-Coral cafe: Coffee, Iced coffee, Pastries, Smoothies, sandwiches, rolls, Paninis: 3 minute walk
-Namak Indian Dining: 7 minute walk
-Liyas: Middle Eastern Restaurant & Takeaway: 7 minute walk
-Spar Mina Road: 7 minute walk

-Wiper & True Brewery: 7 min walk

-Blame Gloria
-Revolution Bristol

column9:
Located in St Agnes & Montpelier Throughout the area are beautifully painted houses and street art side-by-side, the Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is often the first introduction to the area for visitors

Picton Street is really the spine of Montpelier with a number of little shops and cafes, just located off the thoroughfare of Stokes Croft. At the top end there is the always busy Bristolian café, which is great for people watching and brunch.

Close by is also Mina road filled with Breweries, restaurants and cafes. Visit Danny's burgers at the Fierce and Noble breweries for the best voted burger in Bristol.

There are a number of little pubs found within Montpelier, which you wouldn’t know existed if you kept to the main strips.

At the top of the list is The Cadbury, which has the best beer garden in this part of town and does brilliant Sunday roasts, with all meat supplied by Popti & Beast (a butcher based down in St.Werburghs, whi

The apartment itself is part of a new development and can sleep up to 4 guests comfortably. The apartment is 1 of 4 so please enquire if you wish to bring a larger group.
column9:
Located in St Agnes & Montpelier Throughout the area are beautifully painted houses and street art side-by-side, the Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is often the first introduction to the area for visitors

Picton Street is really the spine of Montpelier with a number of little shops and cafes, just located off the thoroughfare of Stokes Croft. At the top end there is the always busy Bristolian café, which is great for people watching and brunch.

Close by is also Mina road filled with Breweries, restaurants and cafes. Visit Danny's burgers at the Fierce and Noble breweries for the best voted burger in Bristol.

There are a number of little pubs found within Montpelier, which you wouldn’t know existed if you kept to the main strips.

At the top of the list is The Cadbury, which has the best beer garden in this part of town and does brilliant Sunday roasts, with all meat supplied by Popti & Beast (a butcher based down in St.Werburghs, whi

Our flat has 2 large double bedrooms, a modern shower room and an open-plan kitchen diner. Please be aware that parties are not allowed as we want to show consideration for our neighbours!
column9: Situated just a 2 minute walk from the vibrant Cotham Hill and Whiteladies Road, our light and spacious flat is the perfect spot for your Bristol getaway! column9:

A Coop Food Store is 5 minutes walk away and there is a corner shop 5 minutes walk in the opposite direction. There is a leisure centre and swimming pool 10 minutes walk away and near to that, is a pub which offers good value food including vegetarian and vegan.

Kingswood has a shopping centre which is one mile away and has free parking. It has well known High Street Retailers, alongside smaller shops. It also has a Wetherspoons, local pubs and wine bars, restaurants and cafes.

column8:
Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located place, just a 3 min stroll to the cafes, bars and attractions of Wapping Wharf & Bristol Harbour.

It's an easy 10 min walk into the city centre and an ideal spot from which to explore Bristol, we’re within walking distance of pretty much everything Bristol has to offer from theatres, the University of Bristol, Ashton Gate to Ashton Court.

It's Ideal for couples, solo adventurers or business travellers.
column9:
My space is in an ideal spot from which to explore Bristol, visit family/friends or provide a base during one of the city's many festivals. Stackpool Road is a main walking/cycling route for people who live in Southville into the city centre. It's a fantastic location, just south of the city centre.

I live in an urban, family neighbourhood, which is very quiet at night despite its proximity to the city centre and has a steady flow of foot traffic during the day. Southville has a strong community spirit and people are friendly. Our 'corner shop' is Better Foods (an organic mini-market), a 24-hour ASDA is five minutes walk away or you can shop at independent stores on East Street and North Street.

Wapping Wharf, a modern harbourside development is a hub for independent food and drink establishments. There are several great coffee shops, fabulous restaurants listed in the Michelin guide, a bakery, pizza restaurant, Mexican, seafood tapas, fish and chips, ice cream sh
column16: I’m a rugby fan who enjoys cooking and eating out with friends and family, I need good food that has bags of flavour! I’m a Dad with a 9 year old daughter, I’m trying to travel as much as I can, enjoy new places and have fun times, this is the main reasons why I have started using my space on Airbnb.

This 4-bedroom house is in the residential area of Bedminster in South Bristol, just a 10-minute drive from the city centre.
Sleeping up to 8 guests in 4 bedrooms it is the perfect space to spend time with colleagues, family and friends, an ideal home from home.

We kindly ask for no loud stag and hen groups and also no loud parties to be mindful of the neighbours please.
column9:
The house is in a prime location for exploring Bristol and its surrounding areas, just a 10-minute drive from the hustle and bustle of the city centre and all of the must see attractions.

North Street is a 15-minute walk from the house, known to be a mini Stokes Croft, it has of lots bars and restaurants as well as cool independent shops and cafes. It is also where Upfest takes place, one of Europe’s largest street art festivals, where you will find the works of many talented artists displayed across the buildings.

A 20-minute walk from the house you will find Ashton Gate Stadium, home to Bristol City FC and Bristol Bears Rugby, the venue also holds concerts during the summer.

The house is located opposite Parson Street train station allowing guests to easily hop on a train to many of the surrounding areas, it is also on a direct bus route into the city centre.

column9:
Coalshed is located in Southville, Bristol. It’s an area of rich coal mine history and backs onto Dame Emily Park, which is a local skatepark with tons of green space, play area, community garden and ball courts

Bristol was named as the best place to live in the UK in a guide by the Sunday Times and Southville is regarded as one of the most sought after areas within it.

Independent cafes, restaurants and shops fill North Street, which is a few moments stroll away from Coalshed.

Each Year Southville hosts a number of events, including UpFest, Europe’s largest Street Art and Graffiti Festival, Bedminster Winter Lantern Parade and North Street Summer and Christmas Fairs.

Coalshed is about a 10-15minute walk away from the City Centre, Harbourside, Southville life has everything you could wish for...

column8:
A stylish, newly-refurbished and comfortable apartment in arguably the best location in Bristol, with a large private garden.

Brand new high-spec kitchen, underfloor heating, smart electric blackout blinds, high speed WiFi, 4K smart TV and a very comfortable king size bed.

A freshly planted and landscaped garden all to yourselves.

column9: Stokes Croft is known as the cultural quarter of Bristol and has iconic street art, a great selection of cafes, bars and restaurants and a vibe all of its own. The flat is ideally situated for taking or leaving everything Stokes Croft has to offer. If you're in the mood, go down the hill and get involved. If not, walk in the other direction and you'll soon in the more restrained Clifton. The posh bit, in other words.
