A spacious 2 bedroom flat just a short walk from Bristol City Centre and located in the heart of a thriving community with independent shops, cafe's and bistros.

Bristol's cultural hub, Stoke's Croft, is just a 10 minute walk away and the trendy Mina road a 5 min walk in the opposite direction.

The apartment itself is part of a local brand new development and can sleep up to 6 guests comfortably. The apartment is 1 of 4 so please enquire if you wish to bring a larger group.
column9:
Located in St Agnes & Montpelier Throughout the area are beautifully painted houses and street art side-by-side, the Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is often the first introduction to the area for visitors

Picton Street is really the spine of Montpelier with a number of little shops and cafes, just located off the thoroughfare of Stokes Croft. At the top end there is the always busy Bristolian café, which is great for people watching and brunch.

Close by is also Mina road filled with Breweries, restaurants and cafes. Visit Danny's burgers at the Fierce and Noble breweries for the best voted burger in Bristol.

There are a number of little pubs found within Montpelier, which you wouldn’t know existed if you kept to the main strips.

At the top of the list is The Cadbury, which has the best beer garden in this part of town and does brilliant Sunday roasts, with all meat supplied by Popti & Beast (a butcher based down in St.Werburghs, whi

column9: Set back on a quiet street, parallel to Park Street which has plenty of late opening bars and night clubs and is a very short walk to the docks and centre of the city.  Our street is suprisingly quiet given it's location!
column16:
Hi I'm Lavinia 

I've lived in Bristol for nearly 25 years and I absolutely love living here! I spent my childhood growing up in the Far East so I've done my fair share of travelling, but I still have a hunger for more! I manage a number of properties for family and friends and I love welcoming new visitors. I know the city like the back of my hand so I'd love to tell you about all the things that go on in our vibrant city. I look forward to welcoming you and making your stay one to remember.

 See you soon Lavinia

column9:
We are situated at the bottom of the road close the all the fun and water front
Literally cross over the road and you are at the waterfront take a right and you can jump on the Grain Barge a floating pub which serves great food and local beers too
They have quiz nights curry nights pie and a pint night it’s fabulous
If you sit on the deck with the trestle tables you always get chatting to people it’s my happy place

Take the left stroll along the water front and you will soon be able to find a cluster of eateries bars and seating areas Spoke and Stringer i highly recommended
If you carry on walking your soon and Millennium Square @Bristol is a must
pop over the bridge and SS Great Britain is waiting for you to board for a historical educational trip on this Iconic piece of history
You will fall in love with the City i guarantee as i did

column7: Simple Bath Road Apartment- Sleeps up to 4
column8:
This one-bedroom ground floor apartment offers a cosy space for up to 4 guests.

Located just a 15-minute walk from Bristol Temple Meads Train Station in the suburb of Totterdown and a 10-minute drive from Cabot Circus Shopping Centre.

The flat is near Paintworks/Bocca Bar on Bath Road, a great base for visiting Bristol and people working in the area.
column9:
Totterdown is as bright and lively as the rows of technicoloured houses its famous for. Cultured and diverse, it’s a neighbourhood with real community spirit, refreshing green spaces, convenient local shops and great pubs and restaurants including The Oxford , The Shakespeare, The star & Dove, Florance, The little kitchen cookery school, Truffle and many more.

Totterdown host a annual Arts trail, where you can stroll and wondering in and out of local houses to view and buy different forms of art. Great day out for all the family.

The Thunderbolt is also a stone's throw from the apartment, a small Victorian pub serving local real ales and live music.

Just 2 minutes walk is The Boca bar and paintworks. Serving pizza and mezza food with a relaxed atmosphere.

Walking distance from the property;
Arnos Vale wedding venue and historic grave yard to explore.
wake the tiger
freedog
temple meads train station
Sainsburys

column16:
Hi! We’re Steve & Claire, welcome to our secret space in our favourite city Bristol!
 
We are both from Bristol and have lived here all our lives, we have been in a relationship for 11 years and love to travel and explore new cultures all over the world. We both work full time jobs but dream about one day being able to travel full time… maybe one day!

A stones throw from the ever popular Whiteladies road, this unique property ticks every box
column9:
Tucked in a quiet side street just off the bustling Whiteladies road this apartment is perfectly set for relaxing and exploring.

Whiteladies road is home to an array of bars and restaurants such as:
The Spiny Lobster
Pizza Workshop
Bosco Pizzeria
Clifton Thai
Alter ego
Pasta loco
Bravas
Kings arms To name a few

Clifton downs are just a short walk up whiteladies road where you can take scenic walks and attend a variety of organised festivals and events throughout the year.
A short walk down Whiteladies road and you will come to The Clifton Triangle. Here there are many more shops bars and restaurants as well as Bristol University and Bristol Royal infirmary, from here you can walk down Bristol's most famous street - Park street and take in the views of the centre and the Christmas lights if you're lucky enough to be visiting in December!
The bottom of park street leads you to Bristol's iconic waterfront area.

column9:
The area really does deliver the best of the country with all the convenience of easy & quick links to both Bristol & Bath without the rush hour traffic.

By day you can take a wander through the nature reserve & view numerous birds (look out for buzzards) & even deer or forage for apples, walnuts and blackberries. By night you can see foxes & badgers.

As far as local amenities are concerned there are the normal pizza, Indian, chippy and cooperative supermarket up the road or you may choose to order a Just Eat, Uber Eats or Deliveroo. In Keynsham (10 minute drive) there are great Indians and a lovely pizza restaurant as well as a Grounded and Bonzo Lounge.

Within driving a 10 minute driving distance we have:
* 24 hour Tesco
* 24 hour Asda
* Lidl
* Aldi
* Waitrose
* Sainsburys

Only being a 20 minute drive to Bristol & a 30 minute drive to Bath, you may want to consider these options:

* 1 minute walk to t

column9:
Located in St Agnes & Montpelier Throughout the area are beautifully painted houses and street art side-by-side, the Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is often the first introduction to the area for visitors

Picton Street is really the spine of Montpelier with a number of little shops and cafes, just located off the thoroughfare of Stokes Croft. At the top end there is the always busy Bristolian café, which is great for people watching and brunch.

Close by is also Mina road filled with Breweries, restaurants and cafes. Visit Danny's burgers at the Fierce and Noble breweries for the best voted burger in Bristol.

There are a number of little pubs found within Montpelier, which you wouldn’t know existed if you kept to the main strips.

At the top of the list is The Cadbury, which has the best beer garden in this part of town and does brilliant Sunday roasts, with all meat supplied by Popti & Beast (a butcher based down in St.Werburghs, whi
column16:

column8:
Welcome to our little cottage located in the popular area of Bedminster, Bristol!
This is a lovingly restored plant filled home- away-from -home found at the end of a quiet little lane.
Whatever your reason for visiting Bristol, if you want a quiet place to retreat to afterwards, surrounded by nature, then this is the place for you.
Chilled vibes only please. Sit and enjoy the bird song in the garden. This is a very tranquil spot close to all that Bristol has to offer but without the noise.
column9: The cottage is located in popular Bedminster down ,just 10 minutes drive to the centre of Bristol! Equally the gorgeous areas of countryside that surround Bristol are very easy to access by car from our house, and Bristol airport is only a 10 minute car/taxi ride away.
column16:
Hi! We are Emma & Daniel, and we are hosting our lovely little cottage for the summer whilst we are staying near by. 
We are Bristol locals and our house is located in beautiful Bedminster down, just on the outskirts of the city, a short drive away from all of the popular Bristol spots. We hope that you enjoy our home and feel free to message us with any questions you may have!

column9: Coalshed is located in Southville, Bristol. It’s an area of rich coal mine history and backs onto Dame Emily Park, which is a local skatepark with tons of green space, play area, community garden and ball courts    Bristol was named as the best place to live in the UK in a guide by the Sunday Times and Southville is regarded as one of the most sought after areas within it.   Independent cafes, restaurants and shops fill North Street, which is a few moments stroll away from Coalshed.    Each Year Southville hosts a number of events, including UpFest, Europe’s largest Street Art and Graffiti Festival, Bedminster Winter Lantern Parade and North Street Summer and Christmas Fairs.   Coalshed is about a 10-15minute walk away from the City Centre, Harbourside, Southville life has everything you could wish for..

column7: Gorgeous 2 bedroom apartment edge of Cabot Circus
column8:
This is a brilliantly designed, spacious 2 bedroom apartment in the vibrant heart of Bristol.
You will love the large living room with dual aspect windows which can be open plane to the kitchen/dining room or divided with bi-fold doors.
The two double bedrooms and large bathroom are nicely divided from the living space, which means they are nice, quiet spaces.
There is also a utility room with washing machine and a dedicated workspace/office.
Downstairs there is a small private patio.

column7: Harbourside Hideaway - Superb Flat with Terrace
column8: Our one bedroom apartment is ideally placed on the iconic Bristol harbourside, and just a stone's throw from the excitement of Bristol city centre. Spend cosy evenings in or enjoy the sun on our luxuriantly furnished terrace! The apartment is situated within walking distance of countless restaurants and bars along the harbourside, as well as attractions like the SS Great Britain, Bristol Aquarium, galleries and museums.
column9: The apartment is in the centre of Bristol's Harbourside and directly opposite the famous SS Great Britain. It is a short walk away from Park Street and Whiteladies Road which have many restaurants and bars. You are also close to Clifton Village, which is full of independent shops and coffee spots as well as the Clifton Suspension Bridge. It's lovely to walk along the waterfront enjoying a sunrise or sunset!
column16:

The studio is in the lively Bristol City Centre! You have great access to Bristol Temple Meads station, local bus stops on Baldwin Street and tons of pubs and restaurants!

Baldwin Street is a pedestrian street, so you can not drive down here as you may get a ticket!

If you are driving, the best places to park are in the surrounding areas; The Galleries, Prince Street NCP, Queens Square.

- Owee Vegan - Approx 2 minute walk

column9:
Located in St Agnes & Montpelier Throughout the area are beautifully painted houses and street art side-by-side, the Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is often the first introduction to the area for visitors

Picton Street is really the spine of Montpelier with a number of little shops and cafes, just located off the thoroughfare of Stokes Croft. At the top end there is the always busy Bristolian café, which is great for people watching and brunch.

Close by is also Mina road filled with Breweries, restaurants and cafes. Visit Danny's burgers at the Fierce and Noble breweries for the best voted burger in Bristol.

There are a number of little pubs found within Montpelier, which you wouldn’t know existed if you kept to the main strips.

At the top of the list is The Cadbury, which has the best beer garden in this part of town and does brilliant Sunday roasts, with all meat supplied by Popti & Beast (a butcher based down in St.Werburghs, whi

column9:
Located within 10 minutes of The Wild Place Project, and with in 15 minutes of The Downs, the historic Clifton Suspension Bridge, the SS Great Britain plus hundreds of bars and restaurants.

The Mall at Cribbs Causeway is a large indoor shopping centre, along with a leisure complex with multi-screen Vue cinema, ten-pin bowling and a large number of restaurants for you to enjoy & is a 10 minute drive away from the house.

There are live play theatres in Bristol , like the Bristol Hippodrome and the Bristol Old Vic where you can enjoy a show of your choice after a fabulous local pre-show dinner.

Bus stops are no more than a 5 minute walk away with routes that can take you to Broadmead where you can find plenty of shops and entertainment.

column9:
The apartment is in the lively Bristol City Centre! You have great access to Bristol Temple Meads station, local bus stops on Baldwin Street and tons of pubs and restaurants!

Baldwin Street is a pedestrian street, so you can not drive down here as you may get a ticket!

If you are driving, the best places to park are in the surrounding areas; The Galleries, Prince Street NCP, Queens Square.

- Owee Vegan - Approx 2 minute walk

2 bedroom, first floor flat with secure parking, located in the Stockwood area.

Guests have full access to the whole flat, which includes;
- 2x Double bedrooms
- Full family bathroom
- Lounge with Smart TV
- Free WiFi throughout
- Linen and towels provided
- Fully equipped kitchen
- Free gated parking
column9:
The area really does deliver convenience with quick links to both Bristol & Bath without the rush hour traffic.

As far as local amenities are concerned there are the normal pizza, Indian, chippy all just up the road, or you may choose to order a just eat. You can also find a small Tesco supermarket a 6 minute drive away.

In Keynsham (10 minute drive) there are great Indians and a lovely pizza restaurant as well as a Grounded and Bonzo Lounge.

Within driving a 10 minute driving range we have:
* 24 hour Tesco
* 24 hour Asda
* Lidl
* Aldi
* Waitrose
* Sainsburys

Only being a 20 minute drive to Bristol & a 30 minute drive to Bath, you may want to consider these options:
* 1 minute walk to the number 2 bus terminal which goes straight down the bus lanes to Bristol city centre every half hour or so.
* 10 minute drive to Keynsham train station where you can get to Bristol or Bath in less than 10 minutes.

column7: Pear Cosy Heated Pod -Secret Garden in the City
column8:
Our cosy Pear Pod is set in a private acre of woodland, meadow and ponds in St Werburghs, which is a family neighbourhood in central Bristol with fantastic local amenities. With views of the allotments and bordered by a nature reserve, you’d never know you’re half an hour's walk to the city centre. Parking is free, with no restrictions on our street. What we offer is basic but beautiful, with a friendly and welcoming reception.

Also check out our Apple Pod and Unique Woodland Yurt :)
column9:
The location of our space is a massive bonus. We live in a friendly, bohemian, family community with lots of lovely cafes and restaurants with outdoor seating, pubs, parks, a climbing centre and an organic supermarket.

The site sits in the heart of the unusual Ashley Vale, next to a city farm and surrounded by allotments on one side and a nature reserve on the other. You'd be forgiven for forgetting that you're in the middle of a city with easy access to both the centre and the M32, to get out to surrounding areas.

column9:
Clifton, located in Bristol, UK, is a picturesque and affluent suburb known for its elegant Georgian architecture, vibrant atmosphere, and stunning views of the Avon Gorge. With its charming streets lined with Georgian and Victorian buildings, Clifton exudes a timeless elegance. The iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge, designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel, spans the gorge and offers breathtaking vistas of the surrounding countryside.

The area boasts a lively cultural scene, with trendy cafes, boutique shops, and artisanal eateries scattered throughout. Visitors can explore attractions such as the Clifton Observatory and Caves, offering panoramic views from its rooftop terrace, or stroll through the scenic Clifton Downs and Clifton Village, known for its quaint squares and leafy green spaces.

Clifton is also home to the prestigious University of Bristol, adding a youthful energy to the area. Whether it's enjoying a leisurely walk along the Avon Gorge, admiring the arch
column16: Prescott Apartments main aim is to provide travellers with the "home away from home" feeling they require. We aim to make your stay quick, easy and enjoyable.

column8: Step out of  this perfectly located newly built urban chic studio house onto Southville's North Street, home of the internationally renowned Street Art festival 'Upfest'. Adorned with striking wall art at every turn you can enjoy a host of independent eateries, shops, bars and coffee shops. Within easy walking distance from all of Bristol's major attractions you can rest peacefully in the stylish and comfortable surrounds of this cosy well equipped home.
column9:
Vibrant Southville is a laid-back residential area and cultural hub on the River Avon’s south bank. At its heart is the dynamic Tobacco Factory Theatres, staging contemporary plays in converted industrial buildings and hosting a weekly Sunday food and crafts market. On lively North Street, the Upfest Gallery organises a popular summer street-art festival. Street art, hip eateries, delis, and craft-beer bars dot the street, and bay-windowed Victorian terraces line nearby roads.
Ashton Gate stadium, home to Bristol City Football team, lies at the end of North Street. A walk through Greville Smyth Park at the end of North Street will take you to the bottom of the Gorge over which stands Brunel's Clifton Suspension Bridge.
In walking distance from North Street is Ashton Court, a mansion with 850 acres of woodland and grassland. Ashton Court boasts stunning views over Bristol, fantastic mountain bike tracks and a public golf course. In the summer it hosts the internationally famo

This beautiful one bedroom apartment over two floors couldn’t be in a better location for exploring Bristol. Nestled just off Park St in the City Centre and only 5 minutes walk from the harbourside and Bristol Hippodrome.

The perfect base to discover everything Bristol has to offer, with its vast selection of bars, restaurants & entertainment venues, you will have everything within reach.

column9:
Park Street is a beautiful Georgian street flanked by excellent independent and boutique shopping, restaurants, cafes and funky bars.
Take a stroll up the hill to find Bristol University and Bristol Museum and Art Gallery. Along with pottery painting, forbidden planet, royal academy Bristol. Brandon hill park is the oldest park in Bristol with Cabot tower which is free to entry, gives you amazing views of the city.

Head towards the bottom of park st you will enter Collage green picnic area faces Bristol Cathedral and Bristol Libary.

Further on down is Bristol city centre and the waterfront where you will find more bars, shops & restaurants along with the historic Bristol Hippodrome Theatre.

Hotwells is a stone throw away on the port city of Bristol waterfront. It is located to the south of and below the high ground of Clifton, and directly to the north of the Floating Harbour. Perfect for food and a pub crawl with over 10 boozers to choo

This beautiful one bedroom apartment over two floors couldn’t be in a better location for exploring Bristol. Nestled just off Park St in the City Centre and only 5 minutes walk from the harbourside and Bristol Hippodrome.

The perfect base to discover everything Bristol has to offer, with its vast selection of bars, restaurants & entertainment venues, you will have everything within reach.

One of two apartments in the building, perfect for larger groups needing multiple places to stay together.
column9:
Park Street is a beautiful Georgian street flanked by excellent independent and boutique shopping, restaurants, cafes and funky bars.
Take a stroll up the hill to find Bristol University and Bristol Museum and Art Gallery. Along with pottery painting, forbidden planet, royal academy Bristol. Brandon hill park is the oldest park in Bristol with Cabot tower which is free to entry, gives you amazing views of the city.

Head towards the bottom of park st you will enter Collage green picnic area faces Bristol Cathedral and Bristol Libary.

Further on down is Bristol city centre and the waterfront where you will find more bars, shops & restaurants along with the historic Bristol Hippodrome Theatre.

Hotwells is a stone throw away on the port city of Bristol waterfront. It is located to the south of and below the high ground of Clifton, and directly to the north of the Floating Harbour. Perfect for food and a pub crawl with over 10 boozers to choo
column16:

column9: The Townhouse is placed minutes from Cabot Circus, close to St Pauls and Stokes Croft, as well as an amazing stay if you are needing to get to the pub!
column16:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

column8:
Stunning 3 bedroom House in the fantastic location of Broomhill. Just a short walk from the peace of Snuff Mills and the river Frome, as well as UWE's Glenside campus and the MOD at Abbeywood. Enjoy some of the best of local green space. Easy metrobus connection to the city centre makes this perfect also for those wanting to explore our vibrant city.

Please be aware, we have a Ring Doorbell on the front door to provide security and peace of mind.
column9:
The house is in an amazing location with convenient access to central Bristol and walks to pubs, bars and restaurants.

Snuff Mills woodland with the river Frome running through it is a stone's throw away, as well as Stoke Park, which if you can muster the uphill walking strength, offers arguably the best view of Bristol!

UWE, the MOD at Abbeywood, Airbus and Rolls Royce are also very local, with Abbeywood being a 7 minute drive.
column16:
Zoe and I are excited to welcome your to our Air B&B. Our work is flexible and in our free time we enjoy travelling and walking with our dog Freddie

We like to provide guests with a welcoming home away from home. We like to give guests privacy but are always on hand to answer any questions should you have any during your stay

We have a good local knowledge of the area and are happy to make recommendations. We look forward to welcoming you :)

column7: 1 Bedroom Apartment in Clifton Village, Bristol
column8:
Beautifully designed 1-bedroom apartment in the heart of Clifton Village, just around the corner from the Suspension Bridge.

Newly renovated, the apartment is tastefully designed with modern & antique furniture and original artworks.

Light and airy south facing open-plan living room & kitchen, spacious bedroom with super-king bed and luxurious bathroom with rainfall shower and roll-top bath. The apartment makes the ultimate comfortable and central base for exploring all Bristol has to offer.
column9:
Just a 5-minute walk from the heart of Clifton Village with plenty of independent cafes, shops & pubs to enjoy.
Clifton Suspension Bridge is just around the corner for must-see views over the river and Bristol & beyond. Easy access to Clifton Downs, Leigh Woods and Ashton Court for fresh air and long walks.
column16: Design and interiors obsessed, plus super passionate about all things food, drink and travel. Originally from London and Devon, Bristol is a great place for it's proximity to London whilst having the countryside on our doorstep. We never tire of seeing the Clifton Suspension bridge, love doing our weekly veg shop in Clifton Village and all the amazing bars, pubs and restaurants on our doorstep. Plus, most places are dog friendly too!

column7: Studio Apartment, Clifton Village Central Bristol
column8:
A luxe hideaway, this newly renovated studio apartment is tucked away in the eaves on the third floor of a pretty Clifton Village building overlooking Princess Victoria Street.

Just a 5-minute walk from the cafes, restaurants & shops of Clifton Village, this is the perfect spot for couples or solo visitors looking to visit Bristol.

Guests will enjoy the stunning views of the Clifton Suspension Bridge & nature trails of the Observatory, situated just around the corner.
column9:
Within the heart of Clifton Village, you'll be in the ideal location for eating and exploring, being just a 5-minute walk from the local pubs, restaurants & cafes.
Bristol's best highlight, Clifton Suspension Bridge, is just around the corner. Stroll over the bridge to Leigh Woods or stay this side and wander around the observatory.

column7: City Centre One Bed Apartment with private parking
column8:
One Bedroom apartment in a truly central location in Bristol. Added bonus of your own private parking space. The apartment is spacious and has a private balcony.

Highlights:
- Gated central Bristol Location
- Private parking for one car
- Lift within the building
- Wifi provided
- Large spacious bedroom and lounge
- Balcony area
column9:
The flat is located in the heart of Bristol, with excellent public transport links all around the city. Cabot Circus with its shops, restaurants and attractions is only a 7 minute walk away, or you can choose to take a stroll along the riverside and take in Bristol's natural beauty.
You are also a 10 min walk from the Wapping Wharf, where you have excellent restaurants all around and is also a great location to chill. Happy to recommend 'Gambas' for some tapas, 'Root' especially if you are a veggie, 'Seven lucky Gods' for some Asian fusion.

column8:
Newly renovated apartment , centrally-located on the vibrant Gloucester Road, with plenty of great bars, restaurants, cafe's and independent shops seconds from the apartment there is lots to do.

St Andrews park is located just across the road, and a short walk takes you to trendy Stokes Croft with more urban bars and independent breweries, leading to Cabot Circus for city centre shopping

Comes with free on-site parking if driving and close to transport links.
column9:
A central and trendy Bristol neighbourhood, with one of longest streets of independent shops in the UK.

Close to Stokes Croft and St Werbergs for local breweries like Wiper and True and New Bristol Brewery.

We are a great location for you to explore all the different areas of Bristol.

column8: Just a ten minute drive from Bristol Airport, the house is a perfect staging point to Bedminster and Bristol City.  The back of the freshly modernised property boasts fantastic views across West Bristol to the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge.  With a bus stop ten meters from the house and free nearby parking options, this house is well suited to those traveling by car or taxi and keen to explore Bedminster by foot.  Additionally, Parson Street Station is a nine minute walk away.

column7: Central, Sofa bed, Wi-Fi, Fully Equipped Kitchen
column8:
Everything you need in one place, in a perfect city centre location. We put your comfort first.

The apartment has a super king bed in the main bedroom which has the option of being split into twin singles. You also have a double sofa bed in the lounge.

The apartment is right on the corner of the famous King Street situated above The King Street Brew House. The street often enjoys live music and late night vibes. I would aware of this if you were after an early night on the weekend!
column9:
This fabulous location is amongst good company; immediate neighbours
include the historic and charming Queens Square, the Old Vic Theatre
and the Waterfront.
The popular west-end destinations of Park Street and Queens Road are
a short walk away, where you can find an abundance of tempting shops,
restaurants, cafes and bars. Here, you will also find Cabot Circus shopping
centre and the famous Hippodrome Theatre.

column7: Unique Clifton apartment on historic crescent
column8: Tucked away on a beautiful pedestrianised crescent, our apartment is situated on the lower ground floor of a Grade 2* listed Georgian townhouse. You will find our home thoughtfully decorated and colourful; a peaceful hidden gem amidst the bustle of Bristol's centre! You can enjoy a picnic in the green square to the front of the house, or relax with a cup of coffee at the bistro table and chairs outside the apartment.
column9: Tucked away in the heart of the city, between Berkeley Square and the Clifton Triangle, the apartment is within easy reach of Bristol’s tourist attractions and shops. The University of Bristol, the Royal West Academy art gallery and Bristol Museum are on the doorstep, and we are just moments away from Brandon Hill, where you can take in views across the whole city. Clifton Village is a 10 minute walk away and boasts a wealth of boutiques, cosy cafes and the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge.
column16:
Hi, I'm Sarah.
I live with my husband, Jonathan, our daughter & our black Labrador in the house above the flat. Jonathan and I both work as barristers and are members of Chambers in Bristol.  
Before we moved to Bristol we lived in an old farmhouse in the depths of West Somerset & before that we were in London.  Bucking the trend, we returned to city life just after the Covid pandemic, in time for our daughter to start secondary school!

column7: Beautiful 2 bedroom garden flat in great location
column8: Located on the outskirts of Clifton village,just a stones throw away from the Clifton suspension bridge and a short walk to the city centre, is this peaceful two bedroom garden flat set in a beautiful Georgian town house. Stylishly presented in a natural warm homely decor with comfy beds, soft cosy blankets and cushions, beautiful house plants, crisp linen and fluffy towels this is the perfect home from home. Ideal for  a small family, anyone working away, or chill with friends and loved ones.
column9: Set on a hill near the Clifton suspension bridge on the edge of Hotwells and the outskirts of clifton village where you will find plenty of bars, restaurants and shops and a short walk to the Clifton downs, the harbour and the city centre.
column16: I enjoy travelling,  exploring new places and meeting new people. I love  cooking, mountain biking, swimming and the outdoors.

column9:
On a very trendy road in St.pauls, Bristol. Located within a 1minute walk to Portland Square and a 3minut walk to Cabot Circus. Stokes Croft and the famous Gloucester road is within 5 minutes walk, full of independent local businesses including bars, pubs, restaurants and shops. This Property is in a real prime location and has easy routes to Temple meads train station and Bristol coach station. Its also within a half an hour drive from Bristol airport. A beautiful holiday home for a week or two or just a place to stay with a comfy bed for a night. In a Vibrant area Surrounded by famous street art, large green spaces, Music, culture and diversity and even all kinds of international cuisine. We are sure you will enjoy your'e stay and we will do everthing we can to ensure your stay is catered to your standards and more.

Kind Rgards
Matthew

column7: Spacious 1 Bedroom Cottage with Garden in Clifton
column8:
Ideally located on the edge of Clifton Village, a light-filled one bedroom cottage with lovely views & a south-facing garden, perfect for a city break or a longer stay.

It's a short walk up a hill to Clifton Village, Hotwells, the Harbourside & the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge & close to a wealth of restaurants, bars, shops, venues & attractions.

It has a kitchen/dining room overlooking the sunny private garden, light-filled living room, triple aspect bedroom & bathroom with large shower.
column9:
The cottage is located on the edge of beautiful Clifton Village, with easy access on foot, by car, by bike or by scooter to all that Clifton and the surrounding areas have to offer.

It's situated in a quiet area, down a footpath which is a 2 minute walk from Granby Hill, while being close to a wide range of places to eat, drink and visit, making it ideal for a relaxing city break or a longer stay.

The cottage is a short walk up Granby Hill into the centre of Clifton Village, with its boutique shops, pretty parks, independent restaurants and the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge

With its leafy roads and crescents, picturesque streets and Victorian and Georgian architecture, Clifton is a wonderful place to stay and the perfect location from which to explore Bristol. Please note that Clifton is on a hill, so some walking is hilly!

If you're driving you will require a visitor's parking permit for every day except Sunday, as Clifton operates a par
column16: I live in Clifton, an area I love, close to the great amenities that Bristol has to offer & the countryside on our doorstep.  My hall floor garden apartment has a contemporary kitchen, 2 ensuite shower rooms, cloakroom, utility room, oak floor, south-facing, secure garden & private parking. On the edge of Clifton Village, my cosy cottage has a triple aspect bedroom with views over the Avon Gorge, a kitchen/dining room, shower room & sunny garden.

column9: Located within 10 minutes of The Wild Place Project, and with in 15 minutes of The Downs, the historic Clifton Suspension Bridge, the SS Great Britain plus hundreds of bars and restaurants. The Mall at Cribbs Causeway is a large indoor shopping centre, along with a leisure complex with multi-screen Vue cinema, ten-pin bowling and a large number of restaurants for you to enjoy & is a 10 minute drive away from the house. column9:
Nestled in the vibrant and eclectic neighborhood of St. Paul's in Bristol, it offers a unique blend of historical charm and modern amenities that is at the heart of a culturally diverse and dynamic community.

St. Paul's is renowned for its rich history, dating back centuries. Once a thriving industrial hub, the area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming into a bustling urban district with a distinct character. Its streets are lined with a mix of Victorian and Georgian architecture, showcasing the area's heritage.

The immediate surroundings are characterized by a lively atmosphere, with bustling streets filled with local shops, cafes, and restaurants. Residents can explore an array of international cuisines, from traditional British fare to exotic flavors from around the globe. The diverse culinary scene reflects the multicultural makeup of the community.

In addition to its culinary offerings, St. Paul's boasts a vibrant arts and music
column16: Prescott Apartments main aim is to provide travellers with the "home away from home" feeling they require. We take pride in our apartments and strive to constantly increase levels of guest satisfaction. Whether you're relocating to the city, after a quick get away or even working in the area. column9:
There are shops like Spar and Tesco Express within walking distance plus a variety of takeaways also nearby. More shopping and restaurants at Abbeywood and at the Cribbs Causeway regional shopping and entertainment venue are also close. A bus ride or taxi down Gloucester Road gets you to many more restaurants, bars and the central parts of Bristol.

A great stay for those working in the area with businesses like Airbus, Rolls Royce, MOD, MBDA UK, BAE, GKN Aerospace, Aviva, SGS/ Filton College, University of the West of England (UWE) and many others less than 10 minutes away.

It’s a short 5 minute drive or 15 minute walk to Abbey Wood Retail Park, which contains a 24 hour Asda Superstore and a 24 hour McDonald’s. The Retail Park also includes restaurants like Bella Italia, Nandos, Frankie & Benny’s and Costa Coffee.

column8: Easton has a hipster, artistic, yet scruffy vibe. This stylish, ground-floor studio is perfect for a city break. A single-room studio, with kitchen, ensuite, Smart TV, comfy double bed, speedy wi-fi, small desk/chair for remote working and a patio at the front. Shops, pubs, artisan bakeries, cafes, restaurants, yoga studios, vegan store all close by. Check my Guidebook in the listing or Google, as not obvious if you don’t know the area, there are so many hidden gems! Free parking 🅿️
column9: Time Out voted Easton the coolest UK neighbourhood to live in due to its incredible friendliness, diversity and inclusion, albeit a bit scruffy. Trains, buses, Tier scooters and the scenic Bristol to Bath bike path are all minutes away from the studio. Pubs, cafes, shops, beautiful parks, takeaways and many artisan, independent businesses, (including seven microbreweries) are close by. Amazing transport links means site seeing in Bristol is quick and easy and there are so many wonderful things to do in Bristol for free.
column16: I am 53 and have lived in Bristol for 24 years as the art, food and music scene is amazing, with beautiful countryside nearby. Our private studio flat is at the front of our friendly, peaceful home, and only the hallway is shared. We have a chocolate labrador called Olive so you may hear me go out twice a day.

column8: This delightful property is situated in Pill, Somerset and can sleep four people in two bedrooms.
column9: Pill is a village in North Somerset, England, situated on the southern bank of the River Avon. The village offers a small selection of pubs, restaurants and shops for fine food and local produce. Visit a number of historic homes with stunning country gardens in the immediate area, or take long walks or cycle along the riverbank. Situated just under 7 miles from the magnificent city of Bristol, which boasts a variety of historical sites, such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Brunel's SS Great Britain museum and the Bristol Museum and Art Gallery. Discover a wide-range of attractions within easy reach, including the thriving city of Bath, just under an hour's drive away.
column16: Sykes Holiday Cottages is an independent holiday cottage rental agency, with the finest selection of holidays across the UK and Ireland. column8:
This little cute one bedroom is located between the lovely Whiteladies road where you can find many restaurants, pubs, bars and supermarkets and Clifton Downs where you can adventure for some walks and a bowl of fresh air.
The property is located in the beautiful Clifton area, only a 20 min walk from the famous Clifton suspension bridge and Clifton village where you'll find charming restaurants, cosy cafes and little independent shops.
column9:
You will be in a very quiet neighborhood only a few steps away from the busy Whiteladies street that offers many restaurants, bars and pubs.
A 10 min walk from the Clifton down shopping centre.
We do advise our guests to try the great Bosco pizzeria for some delicious italien food or Buenasado for some incredible Argentinian meat!
You can also find some fine tapas on Cotham Hill at Bravas, or Muino.
You will be only a half an hour walk to the city centre and the Harbourside but keep in mind that you have many bus options on Whiteladies.

column7: Stunning private one bed flat in Clifton
column8:
Enjoy a relaxing experience at a spacious self- contained Clifton garden flat, which is the whole ground floor of a beautiful restored Regency house. It is minutes walk to Clifton village, with many superb restaurants and lovely green spaces of Clifton Down.
We include one free CV visitor parking permit each night stayed, so you can park near. Extra permits can be purchased for a small fee. No CV permits needed on Sundays.
Flat has: large sitting room; double bedroom; bathroom, kitchen; garden.
column9: Clifton is architecturally very beautiful with its Georgian and Regency terraces. Clifton village has a vast range of excellent restaurants and eateries from Michelin starred and The Ivy brasserie to healthy budget options such as Eat a Pitta. The village also offers some lovely independent store shopping, as well as the very useful Tesco Express. There are some beautiful local garden squares locally and it is a short walk to the iconic Clifton suspension bridge and Clifton Down - which is part of the large open space known as the Downs. The suspension bridge leads to Ashton Gate park, which is yet another beautiful green space nearby. Clifton observatory by the bridge is worth a visit, as is the Royal West of England art gallery and historic Wills memorial building. Whiteladies Road restaurants and Clifton Lido with its renowned brasserie and Bristol Everyman cinema are all just 5-10 minutes walk from the flat. There is also a very useful mini Waitrose just three minutes from the flat
column16: I am a friendly and caring person with a large family of four children, some of which live at home with my husband and I. We live in a lovely home in central Bristol amongst a great local community. I enjoy keeping fit and eating well, as well as travelling and experiencing new countries and cultures.

column9:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Clifton is one of Bristol’s most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters.

Clifton Village boasts an array of luxury boutiques and is well known for its many coffee shops and pubs. Clifton Down Shopping Centre also offers a good variety of shops, as does Whiteladies Road.

Clifton College, Clifton High, Bristol Grammar and QEH, as well as Christchurch and St John’s are all based close by.

Clifton has a lovely mix of Edwardian, Victorian and Georgian houses as well as popular town house flat conversions throughout.

Main roads – Princess Victoria Street (Clifton Village), Whiteladies Road, Pembroke Road and Queens Road.

Main attractions – Bristol Zoo, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and the Downs.

Restaurants – You are spoilt for choice when it comes to fabulous restaurant
column16: Prescott Apartments main aim is to provide travellers with the "home away from home" feeling they require. We take pride in our apartments and strive to constantly increase levels of guest satisfaction. Whether you're relocating to the city, after a quick get away or even working in the area. We aim to make your stay quick, easy and enjoyable.

column9:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Clifton is one of Bristol’s most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters.

Clifton Village boasts an array of luxury boutiques and is well known for its many coffee shops and pubs. Clifton Down Shopping Centre also offers a good variety of shops, as does Whiteladies Road.

Clifton College, Clifton High, Bristol Grammar and QEH, as well as Christchurch and St John’s are all based close by.

Clifton has a lovely mix of Edwardian, Victorian and Georgian houses as well as popular town house flat conversions throughout.

Main roads – Princess Victoria Street (Clifton Village), Whiteladies Road, Pembroke Road and Queens Road.

Main attractions – Bristol Zoo, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and the Downs.

Restaurants – You are spoilt for choice when it comes to fabulous restaurant

The apartment is within the iconic Robinson Building in vibrant Bedminster. Steeped in history, this converted paper bag factory was built in the 1880s and went through an award-winning conversion to apartments in 2009.

This unique building is a sort after spot for locals and visitors alike. A stones throw from popular North Street, it has countless amenities within walking distance including coffee shops, pubs and restaurants.
column9:
Location, location, location!

This property is right in the heart of Bedminster, a stones walk from the vibrant North street, where you will enjoy immersing yourself in different cultures, from food to drinks to shops, you can walk around the world just in this street!

Getting to the Harbourside is also very easy, as well as the city centre, which you can easily reach by foot.

column8: This lovely one bedroom flat is ideally located in Clifton. We are in the heart of Clifton, it's great access to Clifton Village,  Whiteladies Road, the Downs, Park Street and a 2 min walk from the Clifton Down station.
column9:
This property is located in a very quiet neighborhood. There are a few little shops, pubs and an off licence shop in the street. You are also a 2 min walk from the Clifton Down station, and Whiteladies street where you have plenty of bus options, restaurants, bars and pubs.

There is also the Clifton Down Shopping Centre with a big Sainsbury's, where you can do some food shopping.

The Alma Tavern is just across the road, pop in for a bite to eat and a pint, or even to attend their Theatre!

Why not walk to the Clifton Suspension Bridge which is only approx 20 minute walk. or pop into Clifton village which is a 15 min walk!

Stylish 1 bed flat in the city center with your very own cinema!

column9:
With a rich history spanning centuries, Bristol’s modern day Old Market/Barton Vale district has a unique character built from its vibrant residents and businesses alike. You will discover an eclectic blend of vintage stores and independent shops mixed with cool cafés, bars and restaurants as well as art and music venues. On its doorstep, the bustling bars, cafés, theatres and shops of the city centre are all within easy reach and the renowned Cabot Circus shopping centre is just a short walk away.

Bristol is renowned for its rich heritage and vibrant culture. Birthplace of ‘Banksy’ and home to Brunel’s Clifton Suspension Bridge, Bristol plays host to the Bristol Harbour Festival and Bristol International Balloon Fiesta annually, bringing excitement and colour to this already thriving modern city.

column7: The Boat House by Cliftonvalley Apartments
column8:
Your home from home for your visit to the vibrant City of Bristol. Room for you to relax, with two bedrooms, plus a private balcony that over looks Bristol Harbourside and the SS Great Britain.

Located in an ideal location for shopping and restaurants, right in the heart of Bristol. The apartment is directly above Brown & Bye and Restore Café, both offering food & drinks with a beautiful view of the water-font. Within walking distance of hundreds of bars and restaurants in Bristol City Centre.
column9:
A great stay for those attending any events on the Harbourside. Ideally located for the annual Harbour festival!

Also located within 5 minutes of the The Downs, the historic Clifton Suspension Bridge and the SS Great Britain. If you’re looking for something a little further afield, the Bristol Zoo project is a 20 minute drive away. For those who fancy something a more sporty, also within 20 minutes of the apartment is the Filton Driving Range & Adventure Golf Course and The Wave; an inland surfing destination.

The Mall at Cribbs Causeway is a large indoor shopping centre, along with a leisure complex with multi-screen Vue cinema, ten-pin bowling and a large number of restaurants for you to enjoy & it is only a 20 minute drive away from the apartment.

Or why not enjoy a live show at the Bristol Hippodrome or the Bristol Old Vic where you can enjoy a show of your choice after a fabulous local pre-show dinner.

Bus stops are no more than a 5 mi

column8:
Your chance to live like a billionaire at 32'.

This Boeing 727 airliner has the original 1980's private jet interior. Walnut panelling, gold details and crystals adorn this exquisite space ideal for nights away.

It has two lounge spaces, a king-sized bed, two single beds, three toilets, a shower, full kitchen and a fully-fitted cockpit.

Outside there is a large decked area with hot tub and a unique shower mounted underneath the fuselage (separate from the inside shower)

This ground-floor flat has 1 bedroom, 1 lounge with a smart TV &, an equipped kitchen, a washer/dryer, and bathroom.

column16:
Hello! and welcome to our profile.

column9:
Nestled in the vibrant and eclectic neighborhood of St. Paul's in Bristol, it offers a unique blend of historical charm and modern amenities that is at the heart of a culturally diverse and dynamic community.

St. Paul's is renowned for its rich history, dating back centuries. Once a thriving industrial hub, the area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming into a bustling urban district with a distinct character. Its streets are lined with a mix of Victorian and Georgian architecture, showcasing the area's heritage.

The immediate surroundings are characterized by a lively atmosphere, with bustling streets filled with local shops, cafes, and restaurants. Residents can explore an array of international cuisines, from traditional British fare to exotic flavors from around the globe. The diverse culinary scene reflects the multicultural makeup of the community.

In addition to its culinary offerings, St. Paul's boasts a vibrant arts and music

column8: Experience comfort and convenience in our spacious 2-bedroom flat, boasting a tranquil two-level garden. Perfectly located, it's just a 5-min walk to Co-op, a 10-min stroll to shops, and 3 mins to the bus for easy city access. Enjoy modern amenities like high-speed Wi-Fi, smart TV with Chromecast, and a fully-equipped kitchen. Relax in a serene setting with handy city connections. Nearby local breweries and green spaces add to your stay. Ideal for both leisure and business travellers.
column9:
Our flat is nestled in a delightful neighbourhood that strikes a perfect balance between serene residential comfort and convenient access to local attractions and amenities.

Local Shops and Supermarkets: Just a 10-minute walk away, you'll find The Gilmore and a Premier on Birchwood Road for your daily essentials. For a more comprehensive shopping experience, the Co-op at Wyatt's View is a mere 5-minute stroll from the flat.

Transport Links: The locality is well-served by public transport, with the closest bus stop on Wootton Road just 3 minutes away on foot. The 36 bus takes you to the city centre in about 30 minutes, making it easy to explore the wider area.

Green Spaces: Nature lovers will appreciate the proximity to local green spaces like St Anne's Woods, Nightingale Valley, and Eastwood Farm, offering picturesque settings for walks and relaxation.

column16:

column9:
Nestled in the vibrant and eclectic neighborhood of St. Paul's in Bristol, it offers a unique blend of historical charm and modern amenities that is at the heart of a culturally diverse and dynamic community.

St. Paul's is renowned for its rich history, dating back centuries. Once a thriving industrial hub, the area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming into a bustling urban district with a distinct character. Its streets are lined with a mix of Victorian and Georgian architecture, showcasing the area's heritage.

The immediate surroundings are characterized by a lively atmosphere, with bustling streets filled with local shops, cafes, and restaurants. Residents can explore an array of international cuisines, from traditional British fare to exotic flavors from around the globe. The diverse culinary scene reflects the multicultural makeup of the community.

In addition to its culinary offerings, St. Paul's boasts a vibrant arts and music
column16: Prescott Apartments main aim is to provide travellers with the "home away from home" feeling they require. We take pride in our apartments and strive to constantly increase levels of guest satisfaction. Whether you're relocating to the city, after a quick get away or even working in the area. We aim to make your stay quick, easy and enjoyable.

column7: Harbourside Haven - One Bed Apartment with Balcony
column8: Situated just a stones throw from King Street and Queens Square, my home in central Bristol has so much to do and explore right on the doorstep. This one bed, one bath apartment is the perfect place to soak in all the best aspects of Bristol on foot and experience city living.
column9:
From the apartment you can walk to all the harbourside and city centre attractions including the SS Great Britain, M Shed, Millenium Square, The Old Vic Theatre, The Hippodrome, Colston Hall, St Nick’s Market and the main shopping area.

A longer walk takes you up the hill to The University, Cabot Tower and to Clifton Village. Close by there are a wide selection of places to eat and drink including local pubs, harbourside cafes and restaurants including the Michelin Star Casa Mia Restaurant.

column9:
The apartment is a few minutes walk from the bustling Gloucester Road, with many bus routes and cycle paths/bus lanes in to the city centre. Gloucester Rd. has many shops, bars and restaurants with varied cuisine for a night out, or a take away. There is a huge choice of restaurants that will deliver to this area via one of the online food ordering apps like Uber Eats, Just Eat or Deliveroo, or via their own website ordering services.

A short taxi or Uber ride of 1.5-1.8 miles will get you in to the heart of Bristol to enjoy great shopping at Cabot Circus or Broadmead. Bristol’s restaurants, bars, entertainment venues, clubs, cinemas, harbourside dining, tourist venues and theatres are all within easy reach of this fabulously located Bristol gem. We recommend Cabot Circus, the Centre, the harbourside development and the Park Street or Clifton Village areas of Bristol for great places to go out or visit.

Located within 20 minutes of Bristol Zoo Project, The Downs,

column9:
Nestled in the vibrant and eclectic neighborhood of St. Paul's in Bristol, it offers a unique blend of historical charm and modern amenities that is at the heart of a culturally diverse and dynamic community.

St. Paul's is renowned for its rich history, dating back centuries. Once a thriving industrial hub, the area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming into a bustling urban district with a distinct character. Its streets are lined with a mix of Victorian and Georgian architecture, showcasing the area's heritage.

The immediate surroundings are characterized by a lively atmosphere, with bustling streets filled with local shops, cafes, and restaurants. Residents can explore an array of international cuisines, from traditional British fare to exotic flavors from around the globe. The diverse culinary scene reflects the multicultural makeup of the community.

In addition to its culinary offerings, St. Paul's boasts a vibrant arts and music

column9: The area of Redland offers the ideal balance between the bustling city and quiet suburbs. It spreads from Whiteladies road, one of the most famous roads in Bristol with independent shops and café’s set in Georgian buildings, to Gloucester Road known as the indie shopping district of Bristol. So whether you're looking to do a spot of shopping, wine & dine in one of the many restaurants, or enjoy the nightlife of the quirky area, Gloucester Road has it all!

column7: Modern Townhouse in Central Bristol w/ Parking
column8: Discover modern comfort at this stylishly furnished townhouse in Southville. Located on a quiet street yet right opposite the city centre, it offers the best of both worlds. Sleeps up to 6 with 2 double bedrooms, 1 queen & sofa bed. All share 1 bathroom with bath/shower and a downstairs WC. The master has sliding doors leading out to a roof terrace with lovely views and seating. Downstairs, find a well-equipped kitchen, dining and living area with smart TV. Includes permit parking for 1 vehicle.
column9:
This modern townhouse is tucked away on a quiet street in Southville, yet conveniently located to enjoy everything Bristol has to offer. Just down the road, you’ll find the bustling North Street, which is packed with pubs, great restaurants, cafes, artisan shops, breweries and more. The Tobacco Factory is at the centre of it all with regular weekend markets and events. Ashton Gate Stadium is also just a short walk further from here.

Cross the bridge over the river Avon and you'll find yourself in the unique Wapping Wharf in minutes - this cultural quarter boasts eateries and independent shops all housed in refurbished shipping containers. From here, stroll alongside the harbour, hopping in and out of art galleries, coffee shops and the renowned M Shed Museum. In summer, there’s nothing better than sitting on the water’s edge and soaking up the lively vibe of the city.

With so many different neighbourhoods to explore, you can spend days exploring Bristol’s city cen
column16:
We love welcoming new guests to stay with us. As keen travellers ourselves, we always take note of the things we love about our trips and try to bring those elements to our own spaces. Whether that's through little touches in the house or always being available should you need help or local advice.

After using Airbnb as a guest and host for many years, we decided to put our experience to good use and founded Guesthoo - Cornwall & Devon's first Airbnb management company. Now managing properties all over Cornwall, Devon & the South West, we are wholly committed to ensuring our guests have the best experience possible when staying with us. Search 'Guesthoo' online for more information.

column9:
Brislington is an area in the South East side of Bristol. 3 miles from the centre of Bristol and 10 miles from Bath.

The high street with local cafes, restaurants, shops and bars is less than a 30 second walk from the front door of Brislington Base.

Bristol has something for everyone from small quirky venues right up to big-name performers appearing at the Old Vic Theatre and the O2 Academy. There is plenty of shopping available with Broadmead, Cabot Circus, The Mall and lots of independent stores. Whether you are here for work or pleasure if you have any reason to be near the centre of Bristol then this is the perfect location for you.

column8: Welcome to our lovely, self-contained Garden Room for two - with its own separate pedestrian access, nestled in the heart of leafy Redland, just outside the City Centre of Bristol. A quiet and tranquil location, found right next to Redland Green with it’s beautiful Georgian Chapel and abundance of local shops, cafe's, restaurants and more.
column9: Situated just a 2 minute walk from the vibrant Whiteladies Road, our light and spacious home is the perfect spot for your Bristol getaway! The city centre is around a 35 minute walk from us, and filled with shops, restaurants and other attractions. 35 minute walk to the stunning harbourside, and 20 min walk to Clifton Village.

Ideally situated in the heart of the town, it is merely moments away from St. Nicholas Market, the river walk, and just a few minutes from the harborside, showcasing Bristol's finest sights, culture, and nightlife. The well-appointed bright living area with a sizable sofa and dining table, a fully equipped kitchen, a bathroom, and two bedrooms.

column8: Charming 2 bedroom house in the heart of Southville, full of character and spacious rooms.
column9: This is a lovely friendly neighbourhood, easy to walk around and the house is just 10 mins walk from North St, with great restaurants, bars and local shops, or 20 minutes walk from Wapping Wharf on the harbourside.
column16:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

Ideal for a work stay or holiday visit to the vibrant City of Bristol. Plenty of room for you to relax, with 5 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a lounge, kitchen dining area and a garden.

Towels and linen are provided and facilities include a fully equipped kitchen with kettle, toaster, microwave, double oven and hob, fridge/freezer, washing machine, cooking utensils, cutlery (silverware), crockery and glasses. Iron and Ironing Board. You'll have a great time at this comfortable place to stay.

column8: A stunning cosy getaway located within a nature conservation area, only an 8 minute drive from Bristol Parkway Train Station. The space includes a kitchen & bathroom, lounge, central heating and a mezzanine bedroom. A peaceful haven within Bristol. Cycle paths connect the cottage directly to Bristol City Centre along a beautiful riverside path. Snuff Mills nature reserve is a 2 minute walk away, with pleasant walks along the steep wooded banks of the River Frome all the way to Oldbury Park.
